title: Kenneth P. Bliss, Led Sales Of Ads at McGrawHill Unit
description: Kenneth Presbrey Bliss, a retired vice president of McGrawHill International Corporation in charge of advertising sales and a former vice president of the International Advertising Association, died yesterday at Central Suffolk Hospital in Riverhead, L. I. He was 74 years old and lived on Oneck Lane in Westhampton, L. I.

title: Bond St. Having Trouble Meeting Rentals
description: LONDON, Aug. 29  There is a new look here to the street that is London's closest, yet distant, cousin of New York's Fifth Avenue.

title: Dispute Over Art Is Holding Up Cultural Ties for 2 Germanys
description: BERLIN, Aug. 30A dispute over priceless art collections that once belonged to the state of Prussia is blocking progress toward normal cultural relations between East and West Germany.

title: Cyprus Inquiry Starting
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Aug. 31 (AP)Despite strong objections by Turkey, a delegation of the Human Rights Commission of the Council of Europe arrived on Cyprus today to investigate reports of mass murders, rapes and other atrocities and violations of human rights by Turkish troops. The Cyprus Government says the violations went on for months after the Turkish invasion and occupation of nearly half the island last summer.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: TOKYO, Aug. 31 (AP)After winning all but one Individual championship in Japan's national swimming meet, Americans captured the relay events today but missed breaking their own record in the 800meter freestyle relay.

title: ICEPACK LEAVES ALASKAN WATERS
description: BARROW, Alaska, Aug. 29The Arctic icepack that has blocked 47 barges with necessary cargo for the trans Alaska pipeline moved out to sea today, thus ending a monthlong drama in the Chukchi Sea.

title: Lisbon Seen Moving to Revive Economy
description: LISBON, Aug. 31The new Portuguese Government has inherited a series of measures intended to shore up a failing capitalist economymeasures that Gen. Vasco Gonalves, widely accused of seeking a Communist state, pushed through just before his ouster as Premier Friday.

title: H.U.D.'S SECRETARY LAUDS RENT SUBSIDY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (UPI)Under a new program as many as 27 million families could receive Federal assistance to meet their annual rent, the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development said today.

title: Exxon Suspending Its Posted Prices On Domestic Crude
description: Exxon U.S.A., the nation's largest oil company, announced yesterday that it was suspending the posting of prices it pays for domestic crude and condensate, effective today.

title: Dr. Clarence C. Stoughton Dies; ExPresident of Wittenberg, 80
description: Dr. Clarence C. Stoughton, first lay president of Wittenberg University in Springfield. Ohio, and of Wagner College in Grymes Hill, S. I., died yesterday at the Urbana (Ohio) Care Center. He was 80 years old and lived in Springfield.

title: 6 Are Still Jailed for Clash At Rally Against Textbooks
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug. 31 (AP)Six persons remained in jail today after a clash between textbook protesters and the authorities at the conclusion of a rally at a roadside park last night.

title: Gifts: Not for the Bargain Hunter
description: In the tiny den of delights known as the Caviarteria, owner Louis Sobol has been giving thought to giving on the grand scale. The result of his ruminations is an assortment of delicacyofthemouth gift assortments. Prices begin at an openhanded $100, but air shipment is included.

title: Pierre Blaise, the French Star Of Lacombe, Lucien, 24, Killed
description: MONTAUBAN, France, Aug. 31 (Reuters)Pierre Blaise, the young star of the film Lacombe, Lucien, was killed in a car crash near here tonight, the police said. Two other persons also died with the 24yearold Mr. Blaise when the car in which they were riding ran off the road near this southwestern town.

title: Fighting Back, by Rocky Bleier
description: When Rocky Bleier got off the plane he just happened to have with him a copy of Fighting Back. the story of a young man out of Appleton. Wis., by way of Notre Dame, who had both legs shot from under him in Vietnam and still made it all the way hack to a job as running hack on the Pittsburgh Steelers, football champions of the world. He was fresh from Princeton where the Steelers had made an exhibition of themselves against the Flushing Giants, formerly the New Haven Giants and potentially the Hackensack Giants, and he looked ready to fight hack at somebody.

title: 8 Loading Grain for Russia Quit Udder Union Pressure
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 31 (AP)  Eight longshoremen defied their union leadership today and began loading wheat on a Russianbound ship, then halted work under union pressure.

title: Manila Lays Embezzlement To ExAide Now in U.S.
description: MANILA, Aug. 31 (AP)A government prosecutor filed embezzlement charges today against the former presidential press censor, Primitivo Mijares, now in selfimposed exile in the United States. Mr. Mijares is a former National Press Club president and chairman of the defunct Media Advisory Council, which supervised the Philippine press until mid1974. In testimony before a United States Congressional subcommittee he has charged President Ferdinand E. Marcos' 35monthold martial law regime with corruption.

title: Cosmos, in Sweden, Are Beaten by 51
description: MALMO, Sweden, Aug. 31 (AP)  Conny Andersson scored twice and led the Swedish champions, Malmo, to a 51 rout of the New York Cosmos in an exhibition soccer game before 21,785 fans tonight. Malmo, playing without its three best players, led, 20, at halftime.

title: Federal Oil Controls End; Large Price Rises Doubted
description: WASHINGTON, Monday, Sept. 1In an atmosphere of uncertainty and unease, Federal controls on all oil prices ended today, leaving the economy wholly without Federal price ceilings for the first time in four years.

title: Jazzmen in City Still Battle Old Myths
description: The names Ron Carter, Harold Mabern and Jimmy Owens may mean little to the public at large, but among jazzmen they are respected musicians, virtuosos in their own right.

title: Other Nations Outstripping Amtrak Goals
description: Amtrak's new priority plan to upgrade the Northeast Corridor over the next two to three years will not reduce the big margin in speed that hightailing European and Japanese flyers hold over American, trains.

title: Lisbon Premier With No Opponents
description: LISBON, Aug. 31Principally by not doing or saying very much, Vice Mm. Jos Batista Pinheiro de Azevedo, who became Premier of Portugal on Friday, has achieved a politician's dream: being all things to all people. The admiral, an amateur politician in a country dangerously split over the politics of his predecessor, Gen. Vasco Goncalves, has not uttered a word publicly since his appointment.

title: Malta's Leader Asking Spain to Spare Basques
description: VALETTA, Malta, Aug. 31 (Reuters)Prime Minister Dom Mintoff of Malta asked Spain today to spare the lives of two Basque nationalist guerrillas condemned to death for the killing of a Civil Guard.

title: Economic Stimulus Urged, but Simon Says No for U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31Finance ministers representing both rich and poor countries reached agreement today on several issues in the evolving world monetary system, including an on gold, but put off until later the key question of rules for currency exchange rates.

title: Nigeria Extends Control Over the National Press
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Aug. 31 (Agence FrancePresse)  Nigeria's military Government assured itself of effective control of the national press this weekend by acquiring 60 per cent of the country's Times group of newspapers and taking over a northern daily, The New Nigerian.

title: Strike for Unreason . . .
description: The gravest shadow over Labor Day is the wildcat strike that has closed half the country's coal mines. From the standpoint of the national interest in uninterrupted coal productionan interest vastly increased by the need to cut American dependence on imported oilthe most important feature of the contract signed by the United Mine Workers last year was its establishment of streamlined grievance machinery, coupled with a union guarantee against quickie strikes of the kind that have plagued the mine for decades.

title: In London, the Rise and Fall of Biba
description: LONDON, Aug. 21Biba's, the fashion emporium that with Twiggy, Mary Quant, acrd the Beatles seemed to epitomize the swinging sixties in London, will close its doors Sept. 30.

title: Rangel Says Davis, U.S. African Aide, Will Be Reassigned
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 Representative Charles B. Rangel Democrat of Manhattan and chairman of the Congressional Black Caucus, said tonight he had learned that Nathaniel Davis, Assistant Secretary of State for African Affairs, was leaving his post and being reassigned somewhere in government.

title: Margaret DeVries Bride of Robert Neil
description: Margaret Ellen DeVries, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Albert S. DeVries of North Brunswick, N. J., was married there yesterday afternoon to Robert Ernest Neil, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ernest A. Neil of Rockville. Md.

title: For Organized Labor, What Replaces More?
description: Nearly a century ago Samuel Gompers summed up the goals of the American labor movement in the single word more. Asked what labor would want after it got more, his answer was more and more.

title: Soccer Fans Erupt
description: LONDON, Aug. 31 (UPI)  Soccer clubs, police and railroad officials, were picking up the pieces today after fans went on the rampage yesterday as an outburst of hooliganism hit the new soccer season. Chelsea supporters invaded the field and attacked Luton players, who were leading their team, 30. They attacked two Luton officials who tried to stop them and forced the referee to halt the match for four minutes.

title: China's Mongols Have Special Status in Their Region
description: HUHEHOT, China  His Mongolian name is Suhe, but for many years before the Communists took power in Inner Mongolia in 1947 he masqueraded under the Chinese name of Pao Fenglin.

title: Regular Work, Meat on the Table
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.My Granddaddy, called Uncle Bub Able by his friends, was a union man. He had cut his teeth in the labor unions building Wilson Dam for the Tennessee Valley Authority. He was a carpenter then, hammering and sawing to build the cofferdams.

title: Article 3  No Title
DE GUSTIBUS
description: Of cutting surfaces and chopping blocks: In nearly 35 years of keeping house, Belle Hamermesh of Manhattan writes, I have collected some fine knives and have been successful in keeping them cutting well. I'm of the sharpening steel school and there's no problem there.

title: The New Fares and Tolls
description: Following are increased fares on subway, bus and commuter rail lines and higher tolls on Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority facilities that went into effect today:

title: RABBI MAX AR ZT OF SEMINARY DIES
description: Rabbi Max Arzt, vice chancellor of the JewishTheological Seminary of America, died yesterday at his summer home at Lake Mohegan, N.Y. He was 78 years old and lived here.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The mother of a 5yearold girl was still being sought yesterday on a homicide charge in the beating to death of her daughter in Nutley. The child Renee Horst, was found dead Saturday of multiple cuts and blows on her head at the apartment where she lived alone with Lae mother. The divorced mother, Marie Horst, 30, is wanted on charges of homicide and child abuse, according to Police Capt. Donald Casciano.

title: Article 5  No Title
About the Yankees . . .
description: After winning 22 of the first 33 games they played against Western Division teams, the Yankees finished with 38 victories and 34 defeats. Last year they were 48 and 24 At one time earlier this season, the two games the Yankees play in Boston tonight and tomorrow night figured to he crucial. Now they're just another pair of games. George Medich pitches against Rogelio Moret tonight and Pat Dobson and Reggie Cleveland tomorrow night.... The wrong Yankee batboy has been credited with having given Walt Williams a book that stressed the importance of confidence in one's hitting, the book Williams cited after driving in the winning run last friday night. The batboy who gave it to him was William Sablesak.

title: Black Rodeos Gaining Nationwide Popularity
description: GRAY ROCK, Ark., Aug. 31A cry of encouragement for the rider went up from the crowd as the bronco burst from the chute and lurched across the arena, bucking and slashing the air.

title: ... And More Unreason
description: The coal mines are not the only place where the integrity of labormanagement contracts is in peril. George Meany, who certainly knows better, is now carrying to a point of contract repudiation his personal war against dtente in connection with Soviet grain shipments. We are getting hurt, and the hell with the [longshore union] contracts that we are getting hurt on says the president of the A.F.L.C.I.O. This casting overboard of contractual obligations adds a disturbing new dimension to Mr. Meany's adoptionas a means of forcing his private foreign policy on the nationof the political strike technique he always abhorred when practiced by European and leftwing unions.

title: ZaireBacked Faction in Angola Drives on the Capital From North
description: LUANDA, Angola, Aug. 31 (Reuters)The Portuguese High Commission here reported to day that forces of the National Front for the Liberation of Angola had advanced toward Luanda, which is firmly controlled by the rival Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola.

title: About NewYork
description: Labor Day, nowadays, is a nolabor day when worker, and boss, flee city and shop for a threeday holiday that no longer hinges on parades of toilers or the rhetoric of politicians. But there are those who remember when big was not an adjective that went along with labor and New York's garment trades were at the forefront of union struggle.

title: Dodgers Top meets Again, 52
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 31 The New York Mets finished the month of August the way they began it, by failing to win the last two games of a long trip when victory in either would have materially improved their position in the pennant race.

title: Interracial Fete Symbolizes Changes in Black Muslims
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 31  Ron O'Neal, Andy Williams and Howard Cosell signed autographs. Dick Gregory and Sandy Barron told jokes. Fred Williamson, a black actor, led his white date around crowded tables. Phil Donohue, a white television personality, guided a young black woman through the throne of more than 300.

title: Toll Is 8 in Japanese Blast
description: TOKYO, Aug. 31 (UPI)Six persons died today of burns suffered in the explosion of an oil storage tank in southern Japan yesterday, raising the death toll to eight, the police said. Five other persons were injured, two of them seriously, in the explosion at the Nippon Marine Oil Company's waste oil processing plant on the southern island of Shikoku.

title: Metropolitan Area Prices Of Gasoline Vary 10 to 20c
description: With the ending of price stabilization of gasoline, a check of the prices being charged in 103 service stations in the metropolitan area showed the greatest spread in such prices ever known in the industry, amounting in extreme cases to differences of 16 and 20 cents for the same brand and grade of fuel.

title: Article 4  No Title
Levitt Rejects Use of Pension Funds to Ease City's Cash Crisis
Impact of Slump on Unions Worrying Labor Leaders
description: TRENTON, Aug. 31New Jersey's labor leaders, long ac customed to play a strong role in this highly industrialized state, have prepared for tomor row's traditional Labor Day ob servances amid predictions that economic conditions may get better.

title: Inquiry Is Under Way on Deaths Of Two Men in Jersey City Fire
description: Jersey City authorities are investigating the death of two men described as derelicts in a fire in a vacant tenement early Saturday near the city's waterfront. A third man was reported to have been critically burned.

title: Bluegrass Festival Is Cut Short In Dispute Over Payroll Funds
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 31 (UPI)What had been billed as the largest bluegrass music festival ever came to an abrupt halt tonight when a stagehand turned off the footlights and announced that the concert's promoters had walked off with the gate, and that neither he nor any of the performers had been paid.

title: WOMEN ALLOWED TO LEAD RITE AGAIN
description: WOMEN ALLOWED TO LEAD RITE AGAINOBERLIN, Ohio, Aug. 31 (AP) An Episcopal priest again challenged church law and orders from his bishop by permitting women to celebrate communion today.

title: Article 2  No Title
The Welfare World
description: WASHINGTONOne day in 1963, Jawaharlai Nebru asked an American economist for some ideas on how to make India's povertyladen economy more productive.

title: Modern Labor Defended By A.F.L.C.I.O. Official
description: On Labor Day 197589 years after the founding of the American Federation of Labor, 40 years after the founding of the Congress of Industrial Organizations and 20 years after tht, two were merged  the leadership of the A.F.L.C.I.O. finds itself defending labor against critics who charge that it has become fat, satisfied and out of touch with its radical roots.

title: Ellen Kirschner Wed
description: The marriage of Ellen Ruth Kirschner to James F. Moomaw, son of Dr. and Mrs Richard Moomaw of Clarence. N. Y., took place yesterday in Riverdale, the Bronx. Rabbi Burt A. Siegel performed the ceremony at the home of Dr. and Mrs. Paul A. Kirschner, parents of the bride.

title: American League
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: Smaller Whales Are Expected To Be Next Targets of Industry
description: LONDON, Aug. 31 (UPI)The giant whales are dramatic mammals and naturally enough the fight to save them from extinction has caught the public's imagination.

title: Despite Culture Shock, Rural Oklahomans Enjoy Music Festival
description: ATOKA, Okla., Aug. 31Sheriff Cecil Frazier, 64 years old, shifted his weight from one silverCoed cowboy boot to the other and watched incredulously as a naked Leenage girl loped past, waving a smudged Con federate flag and singing along to Jerry Jeff Walker's hit song, Up Against the Wall Redneck Mother.

title: Kathleen Michelle Nowacki Wed
description: Kathleen Michelle Nowacki, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Stanley M. Nowacki of Pottstown, Pa., was married there last evening to RayEric Correa, director of admissions at the Franklin School here. The Rev. Charles Stelmach performed the ceremony in St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church in Pottstown.

title: KISSINGER SEEKS APPROVAL TODAY OF MIDEAST PACT
description: JERUSALEM, Monday, Sept. 1Secretary of State Kissinger and Israeli leaders worked well past midnight to complete the new Sinai agreement with Egypt to set the stage for formal acceptance later today by both Egypt and Israel.

title: More Cities to Integrate Schools
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31Schools open in most communities next week and the problems of desegregation, which have centered primarily in the South since the Supreme Court's landmark Brown decision in 1954, have apparently shifted significantly to the North, the border states and Texas.

title: The Plays of Euripides Still Live in Epidaurus
description: EPIDAURUS, GreeceThe theatrical scene here behind the peaks of the eastern Peloponnesus this summer is much the same as it was when the words of Euripides were first spoken in the theater of Epidaurus almost 2.500 years ago.

title: ClearCut Decision
description: For decades the Federal Government has sanctioned the clearcutting of timber in the national forests, only to discover now through a ruling of the United States Court of Appeals that, for the most part, the practice has been illegal since 1897. The Forest Service's lame argument that a lower Federal court had construed the law too narrowly could not stand up against the contention of conservationists that the language of the law was too plain to be denied.

title: EDISON SQUABBLE AFFECTS U.S. FUNDS
description: EDISONA local squabble over expanding a city park here may help decide whether citizens will have any real voice in how several billion dollars in Federal funds will be spent in the United States.

title: Dance: Park Varieties
description: In this year of socalled dance galas, the New York Dance Festival, sponsored by the New York Shakespeare Festival, is presenting free a dance gala every night.

title: Libertarian Party Names Candidate for No. 2 Post
description: David Bergland, a 40yearold law professor at Western State College in California, won the Libertarian party nomination for Vice President of the United States yesterday.

title: CHARLES B. HALL
description: Charles B. Hall, a vice president of the Bank of the Manhattan Company and then executive secretary of the alumni fund of Williams College from 1948 to his retirement in 1960, died Yesterday at his home in Williamstown, Mass. He was 81 years old.

title: Carey Aides Work to Pare Relief and Medicaid Cost
description: State welfare officials are working under instructions of Governor Carey to develop plans to put a cap on expenditures for welfare and Medicaid in the state budget for the fiscal year starting next April 1.

title: Major Drive on Illicit Sex Is Being Drafted by City
description: An intensive assault on pornography and prostitution, particularly in midtown, which will coordinate business interests, community groups and the police, will be started soon by the city.

title: New Violetta in City Opera Traviata
description: The New York City Opera gave its first fallseason performance of Verdi's La Travitat at the New York State Theater Saturday night and introduced a new Violetta. The role was taken by Karan Armstrong, who may well have done it elsewhere but, up to now, had not been heard and seen in it here.

title: Royal 5Hitter Blanks Yanks
description: Two teams that changed managers not too long ago continued heading yesterday in the same directions they have traveled since those changes.

title: About New York
description: Labor Day, nowadays, is a nolabor day when worker, and boss, flee city and shop for a threeday holiday that no longer hinges on parades of toilers or the rhetoric of politicians. But there are those who remember when big was not an adjective that went along with labor and New York's garment trades were at the forefront of union struggle.

title: Janet Hudson Is Married to Seth Bulow
description: At Temple Kehilath Jeshurun here yesterday, Janet Cass Hudson, a senior at Yale College, was married to Seth Daniel Bulow, a junior at Harvard College. Rabbi Haskel Lookstein performed the ceremony. He was assisted by his father, Rabbi Joseph H. Lookstein.

title: ISRAEL AND EGYPT AGREE ON TEXT OF SINAI ACCORD; RABIN TO SUBMIT IT TODAY
description: JERUSALEM, Monday, Sept. 1  Secretary of State Kissinger announced this morning that Israel and Egypt had reached agreement on the text of a new Sinai accord.

title: Eliott D. Odell, 76. Is Dead; ExFarm Journal Officer
description: Eliott D. Odell, former vice president and director of Farm Journal, died Friday at his home in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 76 years old.

title: Bridge:
description: One of New York's strongest husbandandwife partnerships won the open pairs title at the Greater New York Bridge Association's Knickerbocker sectional tournament at the New York Hilton Hotel Saturday. Harold and Joyce Lilie of Woodmere. L.I., headed a field of 218 pairs.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
DR. HARRY MEYER
description: Dr. Barry Meyer, a metallurgical engineeer who since 1970 had been executive vice president of the Amax Molybdenum and Specialty Metals Group of Amax, Inc., of which he was also a vice president, died Thursday at his home, 10 Cedar Lane, Weston, Conn. He was 44 years old.

title: Teacher Talks Go On As City Deadline Nears
description: Negotiations continued yesterday in an effort to avert citywide strike Sept. 9 by 60,000 New York public school teachers, but no progress on substantive issues was reported.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Newarkbased group is campaigning for a new trial for Ruhin Hurricane Carter, the former boxer, and a codefendant who are serving life sentences for a triple shotgun murder in 1966.

title: Box Office Lines Are Big As 35c Fare Bows Out
description: Despite a limit of one token to a customer, New Yorkers formed long lines at subway token booths throughout the city yesterday on the final day of the 35cent fare.

title: Viking Mission Postponed
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Aug. 31 (AP) The launching of a second Viking mission to Mars has been postponed for more than a week so that the antenna system in the spacecraft can be repaired, space officials said today.

title: Redman 2d To Al Unser In 5000 Race
description: FLOWERY BRANCH, Ga., Aug. 31 (AP)Al Unser rolled past Brian Redman three laps from the finish and held on for a narrow victory, today in the Road Atlanta Formula 5000 auto race.

title: Portugal's Premier Starts Talks on a New Cabinet
description: LISBON, Aug. 31Portugal's new Premier, Vice Adm. Jos Batista Pinheiro de Azevedo, began difficult negotiations today on the formation of a new cabinet amid continuing deep divisions in the country over his predecessor, Gen. Vasco Gonalves, and over the proCommunist line he is said to have promoted.

title: LELAND T. WEED
description: PRESCOTT Ariz., Aug. 31 (UPI) Leland T. Weed, a singing cowboy who played in 22 movies from 1937 to 1944, died Friday of a stroke. He was 74 years old.

title: Article 1  No Title
5 LABOR LEADERS ASSAIL FORD STEPS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31Five labor union leaders joined today in criticizing the Ford Administration's economic polities and suggested such remedies as the creation of public works jobs for the unemployed, a permanent cut in personal income taxes and subsidies ?? home mortgages.

title: Major Drive on Illicit Sex Is Being Drafted by City
description: An intensive assault on pornography and prostitution, particularly in midtown, which will coordinate business interests, community groups and the police, will be started soon by the city.

title: Police in Argentina Rescue Executive, Killing 4 of Captors
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 31 (Reuters)A Britishborn executive, kidnapped a month ago by leftist guerrillas, was rescued today by policemen who shot four of his captors to death.

title: 1974 Strife Echoes in Newark
description: NEWARK, Aug 31 It was just a year ago tomorrow that a bitter confrontation between the police and a large faction of this city's Puerto Rican population, who were celebrating Labor Day weekend in Branch Brook Park, ended in at least one death and many injuries

title: I.T.T. Subsidiary Eased Out of Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 31  A subsidiary of International Telephone & Telegraph responsible for operating and maintaining the entire American military communications system in Thailand, including Lopsecret monitoring stations, has been eased out of the country, its operations here terminating today.

title: Utility Customers Rein, Asked to Share Costs With Stockholders
description: This fall the 2 million customers of the Southern California Gas Company will begin paying a special monthly surcharge that will total $640million over the next seven years.

title: Democrats Here Urged to Reorganize
description: Martin S. Begun, an East Side reform Democratic district leader, has called for restructuring the Manhattan origanization and charged that if it continued meandering the morale of Democrats in the county would be destroyed.

title: Four Million Americans Hold Two or More Jobs
description: Almost four million American workers, age 16 and over, held two or more jobs last spring, according to findings released last night by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Federal Oil Controls End; Large Price Rises Doubted
description: WASHINGTON, Monday, Sept. 1In an atmosphere of uncertainty and unease, Federal controls on all oil prices ended today, leaving the economy wholly without Federal price ceilings for the first time in four years.

title: Cindy Adelson Wed To Steven R. Gardner
description: Cindy Robin Adelson and Steven Roy Gardner, who graduated in May from Boston University, were married last evening at the Tam Crest Country Club, Cresskill, N.J., by Rabbi Bernard Zlotowitz of Tenafly. N.J.

title: A JeffordsWolf Peke Takes BestDog Honors
Those SingleParent Adoptions: Still Rare, but Growing Rapidly
description: Roger Gatke wept tears of joy every night for months just watching his boy sleep. Marjorie Margolies called it hands down, the most selfish thing I've ever done. Amy Anselmi, like the other two, took a child nobody wantedfrom the bottom of the barreland fell in love with her.

title: More Cities to Integrate Schools
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31Schools open in most communities next week and the problems of desegregation, which have centered primarily in the South since the Supreme Court's landmark Brown decision in 1954, have apparently shifted significantly to the North, the border states and Texas.

title: Teachers in Five Catholic High Schools Will Vote Tomorrow on Strike Here
description: Unionized lay teachers at five Roman Catholic high schools in Brooklyn and Queens are expected to vote tomorrow night on whether to strike Wednesday.

title: National Airlines Struck by Attendants
description: Flight attendants struck National Airlines at midnight yesterday, a move expected to close down the airline for the second time in less than 10 months.

title: Walnut Growers of Grenoble Protest California Competition
description: PARIS, Aug. 31Growers of walnuts in the Grenoble area staged protests throughout last night against an influx of cheaper California walnuts that have captured much of the European market from the celebrated Grenoble produce.

title: Lockheed Sought To Give Costly Boat As Impetus to Sale
description: BURBANK, Calif., Aug. 31The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation has told the Securities and Exchange Commission that it sought to give an expensive boat to one of its customers as a sales concession.

title: LEVITT BARS USE OF PENSION FUNDS IN CITY CASH CRISIS
description: Plans to use investments by state pension funds to help tide New York City over its next big cash shortage were jolted yesterday when Controller Arthur Levitt rejected the idea.

title: Carey Aides Work to Pare Relief and Medicaid Cost
description: State welfare officials are working under instructions of Governor Carey to develop plans to put a cap on expenditures for welfare and Medicaid in the state budget for the fiscal year starting next April 1.

title: Jargon Used at I.M.F.
description: The world of international economics has always been overpopulated with obscure committees and concepts intelligible only to insiders and this year is no exception.

title: Personal Finance: Taxing Gifts to Young
description: The tax consequences of gifts to minors are governed by the provisions of the Uniform Gifts to Minors Acts and the Model Gifts of Securities to Minors Acts in each state. Yet individuals frequently take actions in regard to such donations without considering the effect on estate, income and gift taxes.

title: Lockheed Sought To Give Costly Boat As Impetus to Sale
description: BURBANK, Calif., Aug. 31The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation has told the Securities and Exchange Commission that it sought to give an expensive boat to one of its customers as a sales concession.

title: Injury Jeopardizes Woodall's Future With Jets
description: In a poignant scene aboard the Jets' charter yesterday morning, Al Woodall sat next to his new cane, his left knee extended, and admitted he was worried. A few seats in front of him, J. J. Jones slept peacefully, his mouth opened in a grin.

title: Deborah Lopes Cardozo Bride Of Dr. Jay Blum of Beth Israel
description: Deborah Lopes Cardozo and Dr. Jay Richard Blum were married yesterday afternoon at the Spanish and Portuguese Synagogue of Congregation Shearith Israel. The ceremony was performed by the bride's father, Rabbi Abraham Lopes Cardozo, a greatgrandson of David Lopes Cardozo, Chief Rabbi of Amsterdam's Sephardic Jews a century ago.

title: Tanner Is Ousted, but Connors And Other Seeded Men Gain
description: Exercise was the theme, in body and spirit, during the United States Open tennis championships yesterday at the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Camp David Downpour Keeps President Indoors
description: CAMP DAVID, Md., Aug. 31 (AP)Rain drenched this mountaintop retreat today, marring the start of a twoday Labor Day weekend for President Ford and his family. The bad weather forced the Fords to stay indoors, abandoning plans for tennis and swimming.

title: Viola Townsend Winmill, 84, Noted as a Foxhunt Rider
description: Viola Townsend Winmill, a noted foxhunt rider, coach driver and race horse owner, died Thursday in Warrenton, Va. She was 84 years old and formerly lived here and in Mill Neck, L.I.

title: Elizabeth Karess, Chemist, Marries
description: The marriage of Elizabeth Frances Karess and Larry Eugene McCandlish, who received doctorates in chemistry last year from the University of Washington, took place at noon yesterday in Great Neck, L. I. Rabbi Jerome Davidson performed the ceremony in the chapel of Temple BethEl.

title: Firmly Managed Floating Urged by Haves at I.M.F.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31Alfred Hayes, former president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, urged today that the world move toward a system of firmly managed floating of currencyexchange rates to avoid the violent fluctuations that have occurred during the current experiment with floating.

title: Markets Are Closed
description: All domestic securities and commodities markets will be closed today in observance of the Labor Day. Canadian markets will also be closed for the holiday.

title: WAITING TIME CALLED FACTOR IN CAR TESTS
description: TRENTON, Aug. 31 (AP)Thousands of vehicles are failing the state's inspection pro grain because of long waits at the stations, according to data released by the State Department of Environmental Protection.

title: Rebecca Albin Bride Of Cherdpong Punsoni
description: Rebecca Albin and Cherdpong Punsoni, who received master's degrees from Ohio University, were married here yesterday afternoon. Rabbi Charles G. Agin performed the ceremony at the Permanent Mission of Thailand to the United Nations.

title: Teheran Planning One of the World's Largest Plazas
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 31The focal point of Teheran's projected $3billion city center is to be a vast square larger than Red Square in Moscow.

title: Miss Berney Has Nuptials
description: Elizabeth Ann Berney, a student at the University of Chicago School of Law, and Neal Arthur Simkovic, a student at the Northwestern University School of Medicine in Chicago, were married yesterday at noon, Rabbi Fabian Schonfeld performed the ceremony at the Utopia Jewish Center in Fresh Meadows, Queens.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CAVALCADE After its retrospective of 50 MetroGoldwynMayer movies from the golden years of Hollywood, the Regency Theater (5950012), Broadway and 67th Street, is following through with vintage productions from the R.K.O. and Samuel Goldwyn studios. The first double bill, ending tomorrow, includes two Katharine Hepburn films. One is Booth Tarkington's Alice Adams (1935), also starring Fred MacMurray and directed by George Stevens, and the other is Mary of Scotland (1936), with Fredric March and John Ford's direction.

title: Slain Auxiliary Officer to Get City Inspector Funeral
description: Sgt. David Freed, a member of the city's volunteer Auxiliary Police, died yesterday in Lenox Hill Hospital of injuries he suffered while on duty Wednesday night.

title: OILMONEY FLOW TO U.S. DECLINING
description: The overall flow of surplus oil revenues into the United States from Arab nations and other oilexporting states declined sharply during the first half of 1975, but the amount of overseas oil money invested in United States Treasury bonds and notes, stocks and longterm bank deposits soared.

title: Jan Merrill Triumphs in PanAm Test
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 31 Jan Merrill, a slender. 19yearold from Waterford, Conn., ran the second fastest 1,500 meters by an American woman and won the event today in trials for the PanAmerican Games.

title: Hussein Said to Tell U.S. He Might Seek Soviet Arms
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 30 (UPI)King Hussein of Jordan has written to United States Congressional leaders threatening to turn to Moscow for military aid if Washington does not meet Jordan's defense needs, Beirut newspapers said today.

title: Thunder From Moscow
description: What lies behind Moscow's latest bolt of rhetorical thunder against Pekinga 10,000word editorial in the Communist party organ Kommunist whose theme is the need for smashing Maoism? Perhaps the most significant aspect of this renewal of open SinoSoviet animosity is that it comes in the wake of the United States defeat in Southeast Asiathe full eradication of American influence in South Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia as well as the substantial weakening of this country's influence in such neighboring areas as Thailand and the Philippines. It is now evident that the destruction of antiCommunist forces in Indochina has simply created a major new ideological battlefront for Moscow and Peking in their twelveyearold political war. The Russians apparently hold the upper hand in South Vietnam and Laos, and the recent news about the rapidity with which 1,500 Soviet advisers have appeared in Laos indicates the importance the Soviet Union attaches to this area. The Chinese, however, seem to be the prime friends of the present Cambodian ruling group; and it was to Peking that the new Cambodian Government sent its first official delegation of visitors earlier this month.

title: Queen to Be Wins $88,255 Del Mar
description: DEL MAR, Calif., Aug. 31 (AP)Queen to Be, shaky at the break, steadied and moved outside to score an eightlength victory in the $88,255 Del Mar Debutante today.

title: On the Brink
description: The precipitous slide of New York City toward default has at last begun to bring city, state and Federal officials to their senses. The question now is whether the perception of the seriousness of the problem to the people, businesses and financial institutions of this city and region, to cities all across the country and to the national economy comes too late.

title: Books of The Times
description: When Woodrow Wilson was touring Italy as part of the Grand Huzza that preceded the Peace Conference in 1919, a gala performance of Aida was scheduled at La Scala in Milan for which a glittering cast had been commandeered from all over Europe. The house was sold out, not so much for the opera as for the expected presence of the President of the United States of America, the popular champion of a purer peace that would end an impious war.

title: Eskimos Save 23 in Plane Crash In Western Alaska
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska, Aug. 31 (AP)Residents of an Eskimo village rescued 23 survivors from the wreckage of a plane that plunged into a fogAfrouded hillside yesterday on St. Lawrence Island off western Alaska. Ten others died in, the crash, Alaska State troopers said.

title: Advance Continues
description: PANGUILA, Angola, Aug. 31 (Agence FrancePresse) From the hills around this small village, at the very gates of the town of Quifangongo, National Front troops can look down on Luanda, which is held by the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola.

title: Tennis Duo Has Its Own Fans
description: With Kazuko Sawamatsu and Ann Kiyomura, the Wimbledon women's doubles champions, trying to prove that their triumph in England was no fluke, better than half the fans who watched them yesterday at. Forest Hills were distinctly of Japanese descent.

title: Arlene Finger Wed To Howard Kantor
description: Arlene Lois Finger, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harold H. Finger of Manhasset Hills, L. I., was married yesterday to Howard Leonard Kantor, son of Mrs. Jack Kantor of Brooklyn and the late Mr. Kantor. Rabbi Arthur Rosenbaum performed the ceremony at Temple Beth Sholom in Roslyn Heights, L. I.

title: Tempest First at Stamford
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 31 The first Stamford Vineyard race in 20 years ended here early this morning as the last of 74 yachts crossed the finish line off Stamford Harbor. Five yachts broke the Course record of 27 hours 56 minutes for the 250mile race. Cotton Blossom set the record in 1953.

title: Ridley Beats Fergus in Amateur Final
description: RICHMOND, Aug. 31 Fred S. Ridley, a 23yearold law student, defeated Keith Fergus, 2 up in 36 holes and won the 75th United States Amateur golf championship today. To do it he had to fend off two strong rallies and carry his opponent to the final green of the picturesque James River course of the Country Club of Virginia.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Secretary of State Kissinger and Israeli leaders worked well past midnight to complete the Sinai agreement with Egypt and to prepare for formal acceptance of the accord later today by both Egypt and Israel. Israeli officials said that the Americans and Israelis had agreed to seek completion of four documents that make up the total agreement. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 1, 1975

title: Global Research Spurs Plan to Raise Fish Yield
description: VANCOUVER, B.C., Aug. 31 ?? India an annual yield of more than nine tons of fish per acre has been achieved in experimental ponds.

title: 5 LABOR LEADERS ASSAIL FORD STEPS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31Five labor union leaders joined today in criticizing the Ford Administration's economic policies and suggested such remedies as the creation of public works jobs for the unemployed. a permanent cut in personal income taxes and subsidies for home mortgages.

title: Baird Leader With 204
description: ENDICOTT, N. Y., Aug. 31 (AP)Butch Baird shot a par 71 today and retained his lead after the third round of the $175,000 B.C. open golf tournament.

title: Nastase's Case Put Off By Council
description: The Professional Tennis Council deferred a decision yesterday whether to suspend or fine Ilie Nastase, or dismiss charges against him for his performance in the final of the Canadian open championships.

title: TeenAgers in Holdup Spree Rob 13 at Felt Forum Concert
description: Thirteen persons were robbed and your were injured early yesterday morning by a gang of teenagers who roamed the Felt Forum during a rock concert.

title: SpanishLanguage Bookstores on West 14th Street Become Cultural Magnet for Puerto Ricans
description: I didn't know there were so many books on Puerto Rico, the 17yearold New Yorker told Celia Vice.

title: A's Capture Red fox Series In What May Be a Preview
description: Both enjoying substantial leads in their divisions with only four weeks left on the schedule, the Boston Red Sox and the Oakland A's seem likely to meet in the American League's championship plavoffs early next month.

title: HOUSE UNIT BACKS U.S. AID OFFICIALS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (UPI)  United States foreign aid officials in Colombia, Bolivia, Guatemala and the Dominican Republic are more responsive to needs of the poor than the governments of those countries, according to a Congressional report

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The first member of the New York City Auxiliary police to be slain in the line of duty, 20yearold Sgt. David Fred, will be given a full inspector's funeral tomorrow, with Police Commissioner Michael J. Codd and five officers from every precinct in the city expected to attend.

title: Coal Miners Vote To Extend Strike In West Virginia
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug. 31 (UPI)Logan County miners, leaders of an unauthorized coal strike that has idled more than 60,000 members of the United Mine Workers, voted today to continue their walkout in defiance of their union leaders and the courts.

title: Carey Retreat Is In Inn in G.O.P. Stronghold
description: SHELTER ISLAND, L.I. It hardly seems like a gubernatorial retreat.

title: Israelis Report Turning Back 2 Arab Patrols in Galilee Area
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 31  Two Arab guerrilla attempts to infiltrate Galilee were thwarted this weekend by Israeli forces, military headquarters here announced today.

title: LEVITT BARS USE OF PENSION FUNDS IN CITY CASH CRISIS
description: Plans to use investments by state pension funds to help tide New York City over its next big cash shortage were jolted yesterday when Controller Arthur Levitt rejected the idea.

title: Tots Enjoy A Sunday At Belmont
description: Audley Farm's Apollo Nine and Robeau's Beau Bugle, both outsiders, captured their respective divisions of the Fort Marcy Handicap yesterday but for at least 3,000 guests in the crowd of 33,670, the outcomes were of little interest. The reason? The minority group represented small fry on band to watch Sunday racing return from Saratoga to Belmont Park.

title: 3 Charging Bias Rejected Again For City College Medical Class
description: City College's controversial Biomedical program has rejected for a seond time the applications of three white men who are suing for admission on the ground that they were excluded last fall for racial reasons from the doctortraining program.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sealyham Gains Her 28th Top Award
description: PISCATAWAY, NJ., Sept. 1  There seems to be no stopping Ch. Dersade Bobby's Girl, a Sealyham terrier. When she was named best of 1,573 dogs today at the New Brunswick Kennel Club's fixture on Johnson Park, along the banks of the Raritan, it was the 28th time she took the top award.

title: Tom Terrific Fans Johnson and Waddell
description: After the second strike, the awareness began to rumble in the throat of virtually all the 52,410 spectators at Shea Stadium, as if they were gargling on cue. And when Manny Sanguillen of the Pittsburgh Pirates swung and missed the next pitch, the gargle exploded into a roar of appreciationnot only for the record, but also for the man. Tom Seaver of the New York Mets had struck out 200 batters for the eighth consecutive season, also striking out Walter Johnson and Rube Waddell from the record book. He enjoyed the lingering moment, watching Jerry Grote toss the historic ball to the dugout, accepting Grote's congratulations at the mound and softly patting his catcher on the back, listening to the ovation. But, he says, strikeouts aren't any fun particularly, they're just part of the way I attack my job. He attacks it perhaps as well as any pitcher in major league history. For that reason, Tom Terrific is the symbol of the Mets, the Franchise as he's often called. Yesterday the Franchise put the franchise in the National League East race with his 20th victory, a fourhit, 10strikeout, 30 shutout that moved the Mets within four games of first place. In the confusion, Walter Johnson and Rube Waddell lost their lines in the record book.

title: Cost of Juvenile Prisons Shows 40% Rise in 2 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (AP) A new Government report says it cost nearly $10,000 to keep a juvenile delinquent in jail in 1973, about 40 per cent more than the cost two years earlier.

title: Ashe Beaten in Open
description: Arthur Ashe, the Wimbledon champion, was upset by Eddie Dibbs in the fourth round of the United States Open tennis championships at Forest Hills. Rod Laver lost to Bjorn Borg. Page 39.

title: Judges in State Get More Power in Jury Selection
description: In an effort to speed criminal trials, judges across the state today are being given increased power to restrict and control the examination of prospective jurors.

title: Advertising
description: Exactly a year has gone by since the upsets and upheavals at Doyle Dane Bernbach.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Tornado Kills Two in Car
description: CROOKSTON, Minn., Sept. 1 (AP)A farmer and his wife were killed today when a tornado lifted up a car and hurled it several hundred feet, sheriff's officers said. The victims were identified as Ole Ronningen, about 72 years old, and his wife, Agnes, about 65, of rural Climax.

title: Freed Nationalists Find Taiwan Closed, So Return to China
description: HONG KONG, Tuesday, Sept. 2Three former Chinese Nationalist officers who arrived here from China in April hoping to join their families and friends in Taiwan returned to China today after having waited in vain for 140 days.

title: Lisbon's Air Force Head Joins Foes of ProRed as Army Chief
description: LISBON, Sept. 1The head of Portugal's Air Force announced his opposition today to the designation of the Communistleaning former Premier as Chief of Staff of the armed forces.

title: Welcome Initiative
description: With Henry A. Kissinger's speech at the special session of the United Nations General Assembly yesterday, the United States has made its most positive and comprehensive response in years to the demands of the deveIoping countries for a greater share of the world's bounty and fairer conditions of world trade.

title: British Issue Statement
description: LONDON, Sept. 1 (Reuters) Britain warmly welcomed the IsraeliEgyptian interim agreement on Sinai today as a new step on the path toward a just and lasting settlement in the Middle East. A Foreign office statement said that the important thing now will be to try to insure that the momentum gained will he used to make further progress toward comMrehensive solution of the problems of the area.

title: SIZEMORE HEARING TO REOPEN SEPT. 8
description: WASHINGTON, Sep. 1The monthold hearings by the District of Columbia School Board in the dismissal of the Superintendant of Schools, Barbara A. Sizemore, will resume next Monday with the result less than certain.

title: $328,400 SMOG FINE IS PAID BY CHRYSLER
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Sept. 1 (AP)  The Chrysler Corporation paid a $328,400 fine levied by the California Airl Resurces Board for selling highpolluting cars in the state, the board chairman, Tom Quinn, announced today.

title: Dance: Variety of Forms
description: The special children's matinee of the New York Dance Festival at the Delacorte Theater on Sunday had almost everything except children. Tots were outnumbered by adults at least five to one. Those present, however, did see one of the more sensibly timed programs, which ran about an hour and a half instead of the usual three hours or more, and received a vatied introduction to a wide spectrum of dance.

title: Article 6  No Title
Auxiliary Police Death Raises Doubt Over Training
description: A sharp difference of opinion developed yesterday, following the slaying of an auxiliary poiceman, over how sufficiently prepared the city's volunteer Auxiliary Police were to cope with armed assailants.

title: CAREY PROPOSES $2BILLION PLAN ON CITY FINANCES
description: A $2billion financing plan to get the moneyshort city through the next three months and a law to delay payment of some city debts in case the money cannot be raised were proposed by Governor Carey yesterday.

title: Australia Seen as Weighing Role in Timor Crisis
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Sept. 1 Australia is belieyed to have moved closer to an understanding with Portugal on steps to restore order in Portuguese Timor, following talks here today between Prime Minister Gough Whitlam and Dr. Antnio de Almeida Santos, Portugal's special envoy.

title: Seaver Gets Nos. 20 and 200 In 30 Victory Over Pirates
Kashiyama Stops Mensah
description: TOKYO, Sept. 1 (AP)Morito Kashiyama of Japan, the Orient lightweight boxing champion, knocked out Freddie Mensah of Ghana at 1:53 of the sixth round of a scheduled 10round nontitle bout today.

title: ExMayor of Milwaukee to Head Socialist Slate
description: The Socialist party, which has decided to return to the Presidential campaign trail blazed by Eugene V. Debs and Norman Thomas, yesterday chose Frank P. Zeidler, former Milwaukee Mayor, as its standardbearer in 1976.

title: Wheat Farmer Now Must Be a Shrewd Gambler
description: THOMAS, Okla., Aug. 29A. O. Potter's hands are hard half calluses, half groundin dirt. He rides around in a dirty pickup truck, wears a faded baseball cap and always carries a wrench or two in the hip pocket of his blue jeans.

title: Dibbs Overcomes Ashe by 64, 62, 63
description: The generation gap caught ur with Arthnr Ashe and Rod Laver in the United States Open tennis championships yesterday. Perennial stars at Forest Hills for more than a decade, each a former champion and seeded Nos. 4 and 9, respectively, they bowed in startlingly easy fashion to two of the rising crop of slowcourt specialists, Eddie Dibbs and Bjorn Borg.

title: Article 2  No Title
MINERS IGNORE FINE; WALKOUT CONTINUES
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Sept. 1Ignoring a massive and increasing courtimposed fine against their union, defiant coal miners today kept up a crippling wildcat strike.

title: Brock Steals Show On Bob Gibson Day
description: Officially it was Bob Gibson Day in St. Louis yesterday, and the largest crowd of the season, 48,435, showed up in Busch Stadium to help the Cardinals pay tribute to their 39yearold righthander, whose uniform number 45 will be retired when the pitcher ends his career at the end of this season.

title: A Wrong Step In the Crisis
description: WAINSCOTT, L.L, Sept. 1  Even here in this tranquil beach and farm country, where the potato fields run almost to the ocean's edge, it is impossible for New Yorkers on holiday to escape news of the impending financial disaster In their home town.

title: Dallas ExPolice Chief Alleges An F.B.I. CoverUp on Oswald
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 1 (UPI)The Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Dallas police covered up until spring, 1964, a conversation indicating that, the bureau had known that Lee Harvey Oswald was a threat to President Kennedy, The Houston Chronicle reported today.

title: Belmont Jockeys
Ford Gets Fair Rating In Poll of Californians
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 1 (AP)President Ford gets a fair rating in the latest California Poll of Mervin D. Field. The poll, completed last month, also found that Mr. Ford's popularity in California had not changed much since a survey taken last May before the Mayaguez incident.

title: Iverson Gets First Victory On Golf Tour
description: ENDICOTT, N.Y., Sept. 1 (AP)Don Iverson shot a threeunderpar 68 today in the rain in the final round of the B.C. open golf tournament and won a Professional Golfers' Association tournament for the first time with a 72hole score of 274.

title: Article 5  No Title
In Memoriam
description: FIORILLOCarmela. Dear Mom, Hapry Birthday in Heaven. Mass and prayers altered.

title: The Story Beneath the NonStory
description: WASHINGTONMy heart sinks every time I hear about publishers and broadcaststation managers entering the Oval Office of the White House or the inner chambers of governors and mayors. They're all going to get responsible again.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE FIRST TIME. By Karl Fleming and Anne Taylor Fleming. 319 pages. Simon & Schuster. $7.95.

title: Toyota Ends Clinton E. Frank Tie
description: Toyota Motor Sales U.S.A., Inc., of Torrance, Calif., has terminated its 13year relationship with its advertising agencyClinton E. Frank, Inc.

title: Glass Building on Coast Stirs Dispute
description: LOS ANGELES  Although Eastern architectural observers have been looking increasingly toward Los Angeles lately, their interest has centered mainly on this city as an example of exuberant freeway architecture, the landscape of McDonald's and Disneyland. Perhaps the only really conspicuous exception to thisthe only architect to rise above the cacophony of Los Angeles and win the Eastern establishment's respectis Cesar Pelli, a 48yearold Argentine who has been the partner in charge of deisign at Victor Gruen Associates, a major Los Angelesbased commercial firm, since 1968.

title: Chess:
description: MONTILLA, Spain, Aug. 30 While the international Torneo del Vino here starred as the main event in celebration of the grape harvest, Grandmasters Lev Polugaevsky of the Soviet Union and Ivan Radulov of Bulgaria reaped six points each to tie for first prize.

title: Students Seek to Save Chestnut Trees
description: ANNANDALENew Jersey high school students are joining with scientists and the New Jersey Nut Growers Association in a new fight to bring back from near extinction the once mighty American chestnut tree.

title: Bright Indian Blankets to Keep the Autumn Chill Out
description: Bright Indian Blankets to Keep the Autumn Chill Out

title: SHOP TALK
description: The arrival at sundown next Friday of Rosh haShanah, the twoday observance beginning the Jewish New Year of 5736, brings with it reason and ritual for revisiting and shopping on Manhattan's Lower East Side, where so much of American Jewish life had its beginnings and is still preserved.

title: Greyhound Bus Hijacked As It Moves Into Detroit
description: DETROIT, Sept. 1 (UPI)Two men hijacked a Greyhound bus last night on the way from Chicago to Toronto, robbing 38 adults of about $30,000 in cash and valuables.

title: HERBERT M. LEVY
description: Herbert M. Levy, an assistant city corporation counsel who retired in 1973, died Sunday at his home, 19605C 65th Crescent, Fresh Meadows, Queens. He was 67 years old.

title: 13 States Are Asked To Help Find Mother In Child's Slaying
description: The Nutley, N.J., police said yesterday that they had issued a 13state alarm for a local woman sought in the buldgeoning death of her 4year old daughter some time last week.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Israel and Egypt formally initialed a new agreement providing for Israel's withdrawal from some occupied territory in Sinai in return for modest Egyptian political concessions and major pledges of support from the United States. The accord was a foreign policy achievement for the Ford Administration. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Record Narcotics Seizure
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (AP) Seizure in August of 136,608 pounds of narcotics with a street value of over $82million was reported today by the United States Customs Bureau. The confiscations included 68 tons of marijuana worth $39.[09]million, a record for the amount of the drug seized in any one month, Vernon D. Acree commissioner of customs said in a statement.

title: MEANY DOUBTS GAIN IN ECONOMY IN YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (AP) George Meany said today that he did not expect an upturn in the economy during the next year.

title: GUNTRAINING BILL PRESSED IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1A bill mandating the states to spend millions of dollars of Federal tax money each year for the construction of what critics fear will become a nationwide network of target ranges is quietly approaching the House floor.

title: Experts See Loss of Israeli Military Advantages
description: The consensus among United States military sources and European officers familiar with Sinai is that Israel has abandoned significant military advantages in the area as a consequence of the Middle East agreement initialed yesterday. The loss of the Mitla and Gidi passes and, apparently, the mountains that protect the big Israeli air base at Refidim may be balanced by American shipments of the most sophisticated fighter aircraft and electronic countermeasures weapons. But the immediate consequence of the agreement, the sources agreed, is to compromise Israeli's control of the air over central Sinai.

title: PROMOTER DENIES TAKING SHOW CASH
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 1 (UPI)A promoter of what was called the largest bluegrass music festival ever denied today that he had walked off with the gate of the festival, which ended in disarray last night 20 hours early.

title: Muscular Dystrophy Pledges
description: LAS VEGAS, Sept. 1 (AP)The Jerry Lewis Muscular Dystrophy Telethon ended today with a record total of $18,868,499, reportedly the largest sum ever pledged in a single humanitarian fundraising event.

title: Banning Weather War
description: The notion that the heavens can be used as an instrument of warfare seems farfetched and beyond the realm of rationality. Yet the efforts made to seed clouds and produce rainfall along the war trails in Vietnam opened up a Pandora's Box of possible new means of terror in warslarge, small or secret.

title: New Fares and Tolls
description: Following are increased fares on subway, bus and commuter rail lines and higher tolls on Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority facilities that went into effect yesterday:

description: TRENTON, Sept. 1Christopher Dietz, the former Democratic chairman of Union County, is in line for a new post and, in events follow the established pattern, that means the promise of change where he is heading and controversy in his wake.

title: VIOLATIONS ARE LAID TO 11 FOOD OUTLETS
description: The Health Department has released the names of 11 food establishments that were found to have violated the Health Code. They are the following:

title: Plants Reduce Spending Plans; July Building Contracts Off 1%
description: The country's 1,000 largest manufacturers have reduced their capital appropriations in the second quarter by 17.7 per cent, the Conference Board reported yesterday. The appropriations amounting to $9.42billion, seasonally adjusted, which were set aside in the second quarter were down from a revised figure of $11.46billion in the first quarter, and constituted the third quarterly reduction in a row.

title: Libyan President Assails The IsraeliEgyptian Pact
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Sept. 1 (AP) President Muammar elQaddafi marking the sixth anniversary of his IslamicSocialist revolution, condemned the IsraeliEgyptian peace pact tonight and vowed unlimited support to the Palestinians.

title: HELEN L. KITTREDGE
description: Helen Louise Kittredge, formerly treasurer of the Board of Foreign Missions of the Presbyterian Church in the United States and chairman of the Christian social relations department of the United Council of Church Women, died Sunday in Tryon, N.C. She was 89 years old and formerly lived here.

title: 200 Military Police in Lisbon Protest Duty in Angola
description: LISBON, Sept. 1Two hundred Portuguese military policemen in battledress marched in front of the Presidential Palace tonight in protest against being shipped to Angola.

title: Visitors in Hanoi
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Sept. 1 (Agence FrancePresse)Forty foreign delegations have arrived here for North Vietnam's 30th anniversary celebration tomorrow.

title: ECUADOR CRUSHES REVOLT BY TROOPS
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Sept. 1President Guillermo Rodriguez Lara crushed a revolt today by troops who seized the Government Palace but were surrounded and forced to surrender by loyal troops.

title: DR. EDWIN MINER, 68, VORHEES PRESIDENT
description: Dr. Edwin H. Miner, who retired in 1969 as president of Voorhees Technical Institute, now part of the City University of New York, died Sunday in Goshen, N.Y. He was 68 years old and lived in Slate Hill, N.Y.

title: Bunker to Seek Compromise on Panama Canal
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1Ellsworth Bunker will leave here next Sunday to open another round of negotiations with the Panamanian Government on a new treaty on the future of the Panama Canal.

title: Harry Schneiderman, 90, Edited Jewish Year Book
description: Harry Schneiderman, a former assistant secretary of the American Jewish Committee who edited the American Jewish Year Book from 1920 to 1948 and who later edited Who's Who in World Jewry, died yesterday in the Jewish Home and Hospital for the Aged, 120 West 106th Street. He was 90 years old.

title: SCHLESINGER VOWS DEFENSE OF KOREA
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (UPI) Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger called South Korea a shrimp among whales today and warned that United States forces three would use massive conventional firepower against any attack from North Korea.

title: Booing Opposed in New Rules For High School Sport Contests
description: ROBBINSVILLE, Sept. 1 (UPI) Boos, suggestive cheering and critical high school sports reporting are discouraged in a set of crowd control guidelines issued today by the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association.

title: Robbery Suspect Is Killed By Policeman in Springfield
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Sept. (AP)A motorcycle patrolman shot and killed an armed robbery suspect last night, the second killing by a policeman in five days.

title: ECUADOR CRUSHES REVOLT BY TROOPS
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Sept. 1President Guillermo Rodriguez Lara crushed a revolt today by troops who seized the Government Palace but were surrounded and forced to surrender by loyal troops.

description: While New York City officials talk about the psychological boost and the tax revenues that the Democratic National Convention will bring to the city, New York Democratic leaders are talking about how they can parlay their role as convention hosts into a major voice in the selection of the national ticket for the first time since the nomination of John F. Kennedy in 1960.

title: Is Gotham Burning?
description: Tell me this, then, Fanilli said. Do you think that the strike is the only effective weapon in labor's arsenal, or better yet do you think that the firefighters of New York have the right to strike?

description: BASEBALL

title: Article 4  No Title
KISSINGER OFFERS POOR LANDS LINKS TO RICHER NATIONS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 1  The United States, responding to demands from developing countries for radically new ways to bridge the chasm between them and the rich nations, outlined a broad set of specific proposals for cooperation here today.

title: Viking Engineers Press Repairs for Mars Mission
description: CAPE CANAVERAL. Fla., Sept. 1 (UPI)  The Viking 2 spacecraft was removed from the launching pad today, and engineers began searching to correct a radio problem that forced a 10day delay in the nation's second probe for life on Mars.

title: Glasgow Wants Games
description: LONDON, Sept. 1 (AP)The city of Glasgow announced tonight that it planned to apply to stage the 1984 Olympic Games. Meanwhile, the Iranian National Olympic Committee announced that Tehran would also make a bid for the games.

title: Lakewood Schools to Use A Voluntary Busing Plan
description: LAKEWOOD, Sept. 1  Although it still has not received state approval, the local Board of Education here is going forward with its attempt to achieve desegregation of the school system through voluntary programs rather than compulsory busing.

title: Five Die in Plane Crash
description: DAVIS. Okla., Sept. 1 (UPI) A plane crashed into a tree near here today, killing five of six persons aboard. A 6yearold hoy, riding in the back, was unhurt. The pilot was identified as Michael E. Rand, 33 years old, of Dallas. The uninjured boy's mother, her 2monthold and 3yearold children and her sister also were killed. Their identities were withheld pending notification of the children's father.

title: Prayers by a Rabbi Help Thwart Jump From Trade Center
description: A distraught Newark man, threatening for four and a half hours to jump from the 110story south tower of the World Trade Center, was dissuaded last night by a Manhattan rabbi who prayed with the man in Hebrew and English.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HERS She (1935), Hollywood's version of the H. Rider Haggard adventure fantasy with Helen Gahagan, Randolph Scott, Nigel Bruce and Helen Mack, is making a rare appearance tomorrow in the summer festival at the Elgin Cinema (6750935), Eighth Avenue and 19th Street. The picture easily outshines the British remake seen on television, as proved by the program of vintage releases from R.K.O. shown two years ago at Radio City Music Hall.

title: 300,000 Spectators Here See West Indian Parade
description: For a while yesterday carnival came to New York City.

title: Wettest Weather Ever Recorded Here Put the Damper on Summer Fun
description: There are toads on the lawns in Oceanside, L.I. There are slugs on the sidewalks of New Rochelle, N.Y. And there are mosquitoes throughout the metropolitan areaall souvenirs of the wettest summer on record.

title: Southern 500 Won By Allison
description: DARLINGTON, S. C., Sept. 1 (AP)Bobby Allison successfully held off ailing Richard Petty today and won the raindelayed Southern 500 stock car race.

title: Gold Slugs Stolen
description: BOSTON, Sept. 1 (UPI)Gold slugs worth about $105,000. on the way from Pennsylvania to North Andover, Mass., have been stolen from a Logan International Airport terminal.

title: Hanoi Battles On Against Bureaucracy
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Sept. 1 (Agence FrancePresse)North Vietnam will celebrate victories over the French and the Americans tomorrow on the 30th anniversary of Ho Chi Minh's declaration of independence. But another of the late President's main enemies still lives on here.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Front Page 1  No Title
Lisbon's Air Force Head Joins Foes of ProRed as Army Chief
description: LISBON, Sept. 1The head of Portugal's Air Force announced his opposition today to the designation of the Communistleaning former Premier as Chief of Staff of the armed forces.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Federal judge in Newark has ruled that wives must return jewelry given to them by their divorced husbands if the jewery was an investment rather than a personal gift. Judge James A. Coolahan made the ruling in settling a dispute between Walter Cotier of Toms River, N.J., his estranged wife, a Miami jewelry dealer and the Internal Revenue Service. The judge awarded the jewels to the I.R.S. and the jewelry dealer, both of whom were owed money by Mr. Cotier.

title: Teachers Postpone Strike
description: PHILADELPHIA. Sept. 1 (AP) Teachers at the Philadelphia Community College voted tonight to postpone their threatened strike and begin the school year tomorrow as scheduled. A union spokesman. Ben Compaine, said the teachers had voted 140 to 11 to return to classrooms and work under the old contract.

title: MRS. JOHN VAN ESS
description: Dorothy Firman Van Ess, who was formerly with the Arabian Mission of the Reformed Church, in America in Basra, Iraq, died yesterday in Somers, N.Y. She was 90 years old.

title: FORD HAILS STEP
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1President Ford appealed today to Congress to endorse the use of American civilians to monitor the new Sinai agreement, hailing it as one of the most historic peace ventures of the century.

title: EAST GERMAN PLANE CRASHES, KILLING 26
description: LEIPZIG, East Germany, Sept. 1 (Reuters)An East German airliner crashed on its landing approach here today, killing 26 people, airport officials said.

title: There's Always Something to Cheer About at Cheerleader Camp
description: SOUTH SCHROON, N.Y.With 210 teenaged girls and almost as many hair dryers here at Idylwold Cheerleader Camp, it was not especially surprising when a fuse blew the other night.

title: Army Weighs Dispute on Ouster Of Activist WAC Reserve Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (AP) The Army has begun an investigation of the dismissal of Lieut. Col. Grace King, removed Aug. 6 as commander of a Women's Army Corps reserve battalion based in Alexandria, Va., by her brigade commander, Col. William Rumsey.

title: Harlem Housing Project, Begun 5 Years Ago, Is Hopelessly Stalled
description: Construction of an innovative lowincome housing rehabilitation project, begun five years ago in the MilbankFrawley Circle area of central Harlem has hopelessly stalled, and the books of the project are under investigation by Federal and city officials concerned about financial mismanagement.

title: 3 Men and Woman Invade Hotel, Tie 6 And Loot Deposit Boxes of $40,000
description: A team of robbers tied up, six persons and looted 93 safedeposit boxes in the Gramercy Park Hotel early yesterday morning and escaped with at least $40,000 in cash and jewels, the police said. No one was injured.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 2, 1975

title: A Brief War and Then Years of Diplomatic Struggle
description: The new EgyptianIsraeli interim accord on Sinai follows a series of diplomaticnegotiating tours in which Secretary of State Kissinger traveled so often between the capitals of the Middle East that his style of negotiating was widely described as shuttle diplomacy.

title: John Corigliano Is Dead at 74; ExPhilharmonic Concertmaster
description: John Corigliano, concertmaster of the New York Philharmonic from 1943 to 1966, died yesterday in Norwalk (Conn.) Hospital after suffering a cerebral hemorrhage at his 74th birthday party on Thursday at his summer home, 32 Valley Road, Westport. Conn.

title: Bridge:
description: A small group of experts dominated the proceedings in the Knickerbocker sectional tournament of the Greater New York Bridge Association, which ended Sunday at the New York Hilton Hotel.

title: Waldheim Hails Sinai Pact
description: UNITED NATIONS, Sept. 1 (Reuters)Secretary General Waldheim welcomed the initialing of a new interim agreement between Egypt and Israel today and called on all parties to maintain the momentum of Middle East negotiations.

title: Tank Cars Explode in Iowa
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Sept. 1 (AP)A train deraiment on the city's northeast edge today touched off a series of fiery explosions in a half dozen propane gas tank cars. At least three persons were reported injured, one critically.

title: Son of Brandt Questioned On Security, Magazine Says
description: BONN, Sept. 1Peter Brandt, the 26yearold son of Willy Brandt, the former West German Chancellor, was questioned by security agencies last month about alleged radical activities, the weekly news magazine Der Spiegel reported today.

title: Encephalitis Up in Illinois
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 1 (AP)Officials reported 12 new cases of confirmed or possible encepha litis in Illinois, bringing the statewide total today to 84. Most of the new reports cenered in Cook Couny (Chicago), where the director of the state Department of Public Health earlier declared an epidemic of the mosquitoborne disease. Included among the total 84 cases are 18 confirmed infections of the St. Louis strain of encephalitis, 32 probable cases and 34 suspected ones.

title: SAIGON PREPARES FOR A BIG HOLIDAY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 1 (Agence FrancePresse) Tanks have been roaring through the streets of Saigon on recent evenings and workers have been toiling to erect triumphal arches surmounted by portraits of Ho Chi Minh, the late North Vietnamese President.

title: Costlier Token
description: New Yorkers, starting the new work year this morning, will, find themselves paying 50 cents for the subway and bus rides that cost only a nickel as recently as 1948. Commuters coming into the city will be paying 23 to 25 per cent more than they did last week to get to work and to shop. For hundreds of thousands of the working poor in this region, the higher fare is the cruelest kind of tax, especially in a period when the cost of food and most other necessities has begun another vicious upsurge. The thin line between selfsupport and dependence on public welfare will evaporate for many.

title: Bugs Alive Wins Sprint At Ruidoso
description: RUIDOSO, N.M., Sept. 1 (AP)Bugs Alive in 75 brke on top, established early command and sprinted to victory today in the richest horse race in the world, the $1million AllAmerican Futurity.

title: URS B. FURRER, 41, CAMERAMAN, DIES
description: Urs B. Furrer, a leading cinematographer, died of a heart attack Saturday while shooting an industrial film in Detroit. He was 41 years old and lived in Briarcliff Manor, N. Y.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Six Monmouth County youngsters who set a world record for ferris wheel rides continued to increase their world mark in a marathon that began Aug. 9. Each of the six children has spent at least 45 minutes of each hour for the last 23 days aboard the 48foot ferris wheel at the Long Branch Amusement Pier.

title: Soviet Boys Jam Stores for New School Uniforms
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 1Soviet schools opened today, and the little girls in their traditional school uniforms with white pinafores tooked like new blossoms on the streets of Moscow.

title: Supplementary OverCounter Listings
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices as which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: KISSINGER OFFERS P00R LANDS LINKS TO RICHER NATIONS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 1  The United States, responding to demands from developing countries for radically new ways to bridge the chasm between them and the rich nations, outlined a broad set of specific proposals for cooperation here today.

title: FARES RISE TO 50C WITHOUT INCIDENT
description: The new fares on subway, bus and commuter lines went into effect smoothly yesterday, their impact eased by the holiday halffare rates.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: National League

title: PULLBACK IS SET
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt, Sept. 1Israel and Egypt tonight formally initialed a new agreement that provides for Israeli withdrawal from some occupied territory in the Sinai desert in return for modest Egyption political concessions and major pledges of support from the United States.

title: Little Likelihood of Improved Sanitation Is Foreseen
description: The layoff of 1,434 sanitationmen six weeks ago because of the city's fiscal crisis has left New York with 22 per cent fewer garbage collections, street cleaning cut in half, overflowing litter baskets and little prospect for improvement over the long term.

title: Committee of Prominent Citizens Formed to Aid Charter Reform
description: The formation of a committee of prominent New Yorkers ink support of City Charter reform was announced yesterday by Archibald Gillies, who is on leave as president of the John Hay Whitney Foundation to work for approval of the proposals by the voters in Novem ber.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Back around the turn of the century the Pendleton Woolen Mills in Portland, Ore., began making blankets for the Indian trade. Today the socalled Indian blankets, or robes, with their brightly colored geometrics designs are still in demand on the reservations, but have found favor outside too.

title: Delegate Excess Delays SouthWest African Parley
description: WINDHOEK, SouthWest Africa, Sept. 1 (AP)  The first blackwhite conference on the political future of SouthWest Africa adjourned today 90 minutes after it opened because of a congestion problem.

title: SPANISH NEWSMEN PROTEST NEW LAW
description: MADRID, Sept. 1 (UPI) Spanish journalists today protested a new antiterrorist law enacted last week and said it might leave them open to arbitrary prosecution.

title: Third World Economist
