description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1Clemenceau is supposed to have said once that if his son were not a radical by the age of 20 he would disown him, and if he were still a radical by the age of 25, he would disown him. If the remark were serious, then Gumersindo Rodriguez, Venezuela's Minister of Planning, would have been a perfect offspring in the eyes of the French statesman.

title: It's a Field Day for Tennis Fans
description: See Jimmy Connors. See Bjorn Borg.

title: 3 SEEKING REVENGE INJURE GIRL IN ERROR
description: Three young men in a stolen car attempted to run down three other men on a Brooklyn sidewalk yesterday afternoon, but instead struck and critically injured a 16yearold girl, the police reported.

title: DE VALERA'S BODY VIEWED BY 80.000
description: DUBLIN, Sept. 1The body of Eamon de Valera was taken tonight to the ProCathedral where his requiem mass will be celebrated tomorrow before burial at Glasnevin Cemetery.

title: Jewels Ruled Investment, Thus Husband's Property
description: NEWARK (AP)A Federal Judge here has ruled that when husbands invest money in diamond jewelry, wives have to give the jewels back if the marriage is dissolved.

title: Don Juan Appears in Spain, Marking End of Brief Exile
description: PALMA, Mallorca, Sept. 1 (UPU)Don Juan de Borbn, the titular head of the Spanish royal family, lunched today with his son, Prince Juan Carlos in a meeting marking the end of Don Juan's involuntary exile from Spain.

title: Atlanta Editor Named
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 1 (UPI)The Atlanta Constitution has named Harold S. Gulliver to replace Reg Murphy as editor of the paper's editorial pages, starting today. Mr. Murphy took over as editor and publisher of The San Francisco Evening Examiner.

title: Conciliatory Kissinger Message Aims to Soften RichPoor Conflict
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1Secretary of State Kissinger's message today to the seventh special session of the United Nations General Assembly represents an imaginative and indeed highly ingenious development of United States foreign economic policy.

title: Sinai Pact Separates Foes but Divides Allies
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 1The interim disengagement, agreement in the Sinai Desert has divided the Arabs as much as it has the Israelis.

title: Artists on Streets of San Francisco Turning Dull Walk Into an Adventure
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept 1 The streets of San Francisco, one of the nation's most pleasant places for serendipitous strolling, have been the scene in recent months of a sudden growthsome call it an epidemicof street artists.

title: Vikings Top Dolphins on Passes, 207
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Sept. 1 (AP)Fran Tarkenton passed for two touchdowns and Dave Osborn scored another as the Minnesota Vikings whipped the previously unbeaten Miami Dolphins, 207, tonight in a National Football League preseason game.

title: MORE PAYMENTS TIED TO LOCKHEED
description: LOS ANGELES. Sept. 1The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation made payments to foreign journalists to get them to print a news story favorable to the company, according to a wellinformed source.

title: Yanks Use Munson at 3d and Win
description: BOSTON, Sept. 1The Yankees had 14 hits, five walks, two Boston errors and Thurman Munson playing third base and they still had trouble beating the Red Sox tonight.

title: Ashe Beaten in Open
description: Arthur Ashe, the Wimbledon champion, was upset by Eddie Dibbs in the fourth round of the United States Open tennis championships at Forest Hills. Rod Laver lost to Bjorn Borg. Page 39.

title: Jet Camp Is Tense Awaiting Squad Cut
description: If you see me bent over tomorrow, said Garry Puetz, bending over and waddling across a dormitory room at Hofstra University yesterday, then you'll know I was trying to avoid the man with the scythe.

title: Bonn and Tokyo Resisting Call for Economic Stimulus
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1West Germany and Japan joined the United States today in resisting pressure from the International community to stimulate their economies faster in order to lead the world out of recession.

title: Separate and Female
description: Only a few years ago, the women's colleges seemed as obsolete as the corset, doomed to extinction by the general rush to coeducation. Only a resolute few held out against these dire forecasts, telling their critics it was contradictory to hail American higher education's diversity while insisting that they follow the herd.

title: Saskatchewan Victor
description: REGINA, Saskatchewan, Sept. 1 (AP)Ron Lancaster's 9yard pass to Steve Mazurak late in the final quarter gave the Saskatchewan Roughriders a 2723 victory over the Winnipeg Blue Bombers in a Canadian Football League game today.

title: Kissinger Taped Again, But Ford Assures Him
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1When President Ford telephoned Secretary of State Kissinger in Jerusalem today to exchange congratulations on the new Middle East accord, he began the conversation by telling Mr. Kissinger that they were being taped.

title: Downfall of a Minority Contractor
description: H. Earl Spaulding started working on construction jobs 22 years ago, when he was 17.

title: Bills Topple Browns
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 1 (AP) Joe Ferguson threw two touchdown passes and Tom, Donchez, a rookie, scored twice today, helping the Buffalo Bills beat the Cleveland Browns, 3420, in an errorfilled National Football League preseason game.

title: Magnetic Monopoles
description: A sensation has just been caused in the world of physics by the claim of a group of American researchers that they have detected the first magnetic monopole ever found. If confirmed, this result will have the same importance for the understanding of magnetism that the discovery of the electron and the proton had for understanding of electricity. In a sense scientists have been expecting some such breakthrough since the mid1860's when James Clerk Maxwell first published his basic equations for electromagnetism with their implied full symmetry of electricity and magnetism. Then in 1931 Paul A. M. Dirac showed that modern quantum mechanics also seemed to imply the existence of magnetic monopoles.

title: Wheat Farmer Now Must Be a Shrewd Gambler
description: THOMAS, Okla., Aug. 29A. O. Potter's hands are hard half calluses, halfgroundin dirt. He rides around in a dirty pickup truck, wears a faded baseball cap and always carries a wrench or two in the hip pocket of his blue jeans.

title: Pollution Gone, Swimming Returns to Ronkonkoma
description: LAKE RONKONKOMA, L. I., Sept. 1Walter Hethy gazed at shimmering expanse of Lake Ronkonkoma this afternoon and fondly recalled the time when this suburban community was a resort area.

title: Work Release Project for Prisoners Is Canceled Over Corruption Charges
description: A $1million city and Federal project that enabled certain inmates to live in a hotel while working outside the city's jails has not been renewed, following an inquiry into reports that some organizedcrime figures had bought their hotel assignments.

title: Alabama Prison Disorder
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Sept. 1 (UPI)Seventeen inmates at the medical and diagnostic center at nearby Mount Meigs were injured tonight in a disturbance that was quelled by state troopers who fired shots inside the prison. None of the inmates were believed to have serious injuries. William Long, the warden, said the disturbance in the overcrowded prison was apparently racially motivated.

title: For Egyptians, U.S. Role Is Biggest Gain
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt, Sept. 1 For President Anwar elSadat the most important single aspect of the new disengagement agreement, in the view of officials here, is the direct involvement of the United States in the Middle East.

title: Wood, Field & Stream
description: The plethora of books on angling that have appeared in the last decade leaves one yearning for the good old days when all that was needed to go fishing was a day off, a few worms and a cane pole.

title: PULLBACK IS SET
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt, Sept. 1Israel and Egypt tonight formally initialed a new agreement that provides for Israeli withdrawal from some occupied territory in the Sinai desert in return for modest Egyption political concessions and major pledges of support from the United States.

title: S.I. Man Killed in Crash
description: NEPTUNE, Sept. 1 (UPI)A Staten Island man was killed early today when his car struck a guard rail and flipped over on Garden State Parkway exit ramp 98 near here. The state police identified the victim as Dennis Daquila, 23 years old.

title: 7 South Africans Killed
description: DURBAN, South Africa, Sept. 1 (Reuters)Seven black African laborers were killed by fumes here today when fire ripped through an underground tunnel.

title: Inner Mongolians Appear in Force For Mere Peek at Foreign Visitors
description: SILINHOT, China  Inner Mongolia is the place where any Westerner can discover how it feels to be a celebrity. Western visitors are so rare that their mere appearance on a street will collect a crowdquickly by the score and soon by the hundreds.

title: Telluride Festival in Colorado Forms a Peak for Movie Buffs
description: TELLURIDE, Colo., Sept. 1The Telluride Film Festival, whose debut last year was marked by controversy over its tribute to Leni Riefenstahl, the Nazi director, was as American as apple pie this year.

title: Excerpts From Kissinger's Address, Read to the U.N. Assembly by Moynihan
description: UNITED NATIONS. N. Y., Sept. 1rollovving, as prepared for delivery, the text of Secretary of State Kissinger's address to the special session of the General Assembly today. It was read by Daniel P. Moynihan, the United States representative.

title: VIEW OF ISRAELIS: BEST ATTAINABLE
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 1To most Israeli officials tonight, Egypt's agreement to sign a conciliatory document with Israel appeared at least as important as the terms of the agreement.

title: Trainer Asks Hearing
description: TRENTON, Sept. 1  The Superior Court here has ordered the State Racing Commission to show cause why George Sipp Jr., thoroughbred trainer of Morristown, N. J., should not be given a full commission hearing.

title: FORD HAILS STEP
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 President Ford appealed today to Congress to endorse the use of American civilians to monitor the new Sinai agreement, hailing it as one of the most historic peace ventures of the century.

title: Persepolis Ruins Frame Shiraz Festival of Arts
description: SHIRAZ, Iran, Sept. 1 Requiring spectators to trek among the towering ruins of Persepolis, the avantgarde stage director Andrei Serban brought the ninth Iran Festival of the Arts to a close Saturday with a mobile production of Elektra, The Trojan Women and Medea that began at the gates of the royal city and wound up four hours later in front of the 2,500yearold tomb of Artaxerxes II.

title: Ford About to Decide on Seeking Agency to Allot Funds for Energy Projects
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 President Ford is expected to decide within days whether to ask Congress to authorize a quasipublic corporation to channel up to $100billion to projects aimed at making the United States independent of foreign sources of energy.

title: Bonn and Tokyo Resisting Call for Economic Stimulus
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1West Germany and Japan joined the United States today in resisting pressure from the International community to stimulate their economies faster in order to lead the world out of recession.

title: Amid Layoffs, Auto Output Is Being Pushed
description: DETROIT, Sept. 1  The nation's automobile industry, trying to recover from its worst postwar slump, will step up production of 1976 cars in September, but without the heavy overtime of the boom times of years past. Unemployment in the auto industry is still higher than the national jobless rate of 8.2 per cent. The Labor Day weekend found 84.275 auto workers still on indefinite layoff, 11.8 per cent of the industry's work force. This, however, was a major improvement from the peak of 274,380 idle in the week of Feb. 3, when the industry jobless rate reached 38.5 per cent.

title: Foolish Pleasure Runs 2d to Wajima
description: The most brilliant thoroughbred field of the year, one which included outstanding older horses as well as outstanding 3yearolds, met in the seventh running of the Governor at Belmont Park yesterday. When the $115,300 contest concluded, Wajima, one of those 3yearolds, was ushered into the winners' circle.

title: Expert Warns of Acceleration in Extinction of Animal Species Despite Conservation Bids
description: Despite current conservation efforts, there is no evidence of significant abatement in the accelerating pace of animal extinctions, according to one authority.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Sept. 1 (AP)The price of gold fell sharply on European bullion markets today. The skid followed agreement by the International Monetary Fund in Washington over the weekend to sell off onesixth of its gold holdings in a major monetary reform program. In London, the metal plunged from Friday's closing price by $5.25 to $154.25 an ounce, its lowest level since midOctober when the price was fixed at $154.20. Dealers reported a hectic morning of inquiries and deals, but said the volume of sales was still moderate.

title: Plan to Save Wild Rivers Falls Behind
description: GRANTS PASS, Ore.It is hereby declared to be the policy of the United States that certain selected rivers of the nation . . . shall be protected for the benefit and enjoyment of future generations.

title: A LIGHTER SLATE OF FINANCINGS DUE
description: The calendar in the credit marketsGovernment, corporate and tax exemptfor September shapes up as moderate in size and should represent something of a breather for participants.

title: Major Findings on Fats' Role in Inherited Diseases Offer LifeSaving Clues
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1. The death of a patient is a severe blow to any doctor. When the doctor is a young medical student, the shock can be even deeper and more enduring.

title: Trade Center, With Golf, Set in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 1  The cornerstone was formally laid today for a new International Trade Center in Moscow, starting construction of a multimilliondollar EastWest project financed in part by American Government credits.

title: British Football
description: By Reuters

title: Anker Vows He'll Open Schools in Case of Strike
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker vowed yesterday to open all city schools next week as efforts aimed at averting a city teachers' strike continued with no signs of substantial progress.

title: Camera Craze Creates Haute Culture in Paris
description: PARISA few weeks ago Michel Guy, France's Minister of Culture, announced the creation of a French center of photography that will commission works, grant scholarships and organize exhibitions.

title: Fans Ponder Portent of Giants' 40 Mark
description: These are the times when Giants' fans, at least some of them, would be happier if the team lost all its preseason games.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Zaire Dooms 7 Officers Accused of Role in Plot
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Sept. 1 (UPI)Seven highranking officers, including the former Zaire military attache in Washington, were condemned to death today in connection with an attempt to overthrow President Mobutu Sese Seko in June.

title: TV: Portrait of MacArthur in The Commanders
description: For an encore, for something with more panache than the typical program of old TV series and even older movies, WOR/Channel 9 has become rather partial to World War II. Not too long ago, the station offered World at War, an extended panoramic series consisting of archive film footage and related interviews.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Music

title: MAINE TO RECOVER MORE FOREST LAND
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Sept. 1Maine officals are about to announce the recovery of 10,000 more acres of a 396,000acre wilderness reserve the state let fall into the hands of large private landowners a century ago.

title: SEQUOIA FOREST FIRE SPREADING ON COAST
description: PORTERVILLE, Calif., Sept. 1 (UPI)A fire spread over thousands of acres today in the Sequoia National Forest. Officials said, that it had been caused by a careless camper.

title: ECONOMISTS FIND NO WORLD CRISIS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1While the world's leading financial authorities convene in Washington to discuss the shape of the international economic system, a group of their predecessors has issued a set of recommendations on trade, aid, and monetary reform.

title: Pentagon Says I.R.A. Stole Arms at U.S. Bases
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (Reuters)The outlawed Irish Republican Army has stolen weapons from United States military bases for shipment to Northern Ireland, according to a Defense Department document made public today.

title: CAREY PROPOSES $2BIELION PLAN ON CITY FINANCES
description: A $2billion financing plan to get the moneyshort city through the next three months and, a law to delay payment of some city debts in case the money cannot be raised were proposed by Governor Carey yesterday.

title: Market Place
description: In order to raise new money, a number of companies have been selling issues of preferred stock. The most notable example is found in electric and gas utilities that look upon preferreds as a source of funds to supplement floating bond issues.

title: Analysts Lack Consensus on the Securities Outlook
description: The securities markets face the new business year, which traditionally begins after the Labor Day holiday, without consensus  unconvinced that inflation can be brought under control or that the recovery will gain strength.

title: Bronx Woman Is Arrested As False Maid in Robberies
description: A 22yearold Bronx woman who the police said posed as a maid to rob wealthy homes was arrested yesterday and charged with committing four thefts in which goods ranging in value from $3,000 to $25,000 were taken.

title: 6,195 Municipal Defaults Tallied in U.S., And in Most Cases Creditors Got Paid
description: During the Great Depression 45 years ago, the town of Fall River, Mass., defaulted on a snowballing debt. Its credit vanished, its citizens refused to pay their taxes, its officials were humiliated, and state receivers took over the reins of local government for a decade.

title: Britain Hails Boulez and Philharmonic
description: LONDON, Sept. 1Pierre Boulez's first and probably only European tour with the New York Philharmonic began in Edinburgh and London last week with results that seemed to please the conductor, the orchestra, the audiences and, for the most part, the critics.

title: A Tale of Two Planets
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 31  An eerie week. Daytimes I'd go to Washington, sit in the marble and listen to people with Federalprose faces talk cosmic. A few billion dollars here, a billion there, war, peace, Kissinger, gross national product, doubledigit inflation, Presidential politics, future of America.

title: FARES RISE TO 50C WITHOUT INCIDENT
description: The new fares on subway, bus and commuter lines went into effect smoothly yesterday, their impact eased by the holiday halffare rates.

title: Markets Were Closed
description: All domestic securities and commodities markets were closed yesterday in observance of Labor Day. Canadian markets were also closed for the holiday.

title: Texts of the EgyptianIsraeli Agreements on Disengagement in the Sinai Desert
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 1 (Reuters)Following are the texts of the EgyptianIsraeli agreement on Sinai, the United States proposal for an earlywarning system in Sinai and the annex to the EgyptianIsraeli agreement:

title: National Airlines Struck; Washington Talks Held
description: MIAMI, Sept. 1 (UPI)About 1,200 flight attendants grounded National Airlines with its second major strike in less than 10 months today, but the union announced that contract talks between the two sides resumed a few hours later in Washington.

title: Two Shuttles: From Failure to Accord
description: GEOGRAPHIC In March, Egypt demanded that Israel withdraw completely from the Mitla and Gidi passes and from the Abu Rudeis oilfield. For what Egypt was prepared to give in political concessions, Israel offered to pull back from only half the lengths of the passes and would not agree to give Egypt a road under Egyptian control to the field.

title: U.S.C. Beats Japan
description: NIIOGATA, Japan, Sept. 1 (AP)The touring University ketball team beat Japan's national team, 9185, today with Earl Evans scoring 20 points.

title: Big New Assembly Building Is Opened in South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 1 President Park Chung Hee and other officials cut the tape today to open a huge new National Assembly building on an island in the Han River in the southern part of Seoul.

title: M.A.C. PLAN SEEKS TORESTRUCTURE CITY FINANCIALLY
description: A stringent plan that would restructure the city financially, providing for the possibility of municipal default and virtually erasing, the budgetary powers of the Mayor, was sent to Governor Carey and legislative leaders yesterday by the Municipal Assistance Corporation.

title: SIMON CAUTIONS ON OILPRICE RISE
description: WASHINGTON Sept,. 2The United Stateswith little overt support from the other industrialized countriesemphasized today that another increase in the world price of oil would seriously jeopardize the balance upon which, global economic recovery depends.

title: FOSTER SON FOCUS OF HOFFA INQUIRY
description: DETROIT, Sept. 2Investigators looking into the disappearance of James R. Hoffa are still concentrating on Charles L. J. O'Brien, the roster son of Mr. Hoffa, the former teamster leader, and they consider a car that Mr. O'Brien drove on the day of the disappearance important evidence, Government attorneys said today at a court hearing.

title: TRADE PROBLEMS HELD FORMIDABLE
description: GENEVA, Sept. 3If the brightening prospects for an economic upturn before the year is out are confirmed, the industrial world will face the formidable problem of increasing production to meet the demand for more goods and services without triggering a new round of inflation, according to an international study.

title: Football Squad Limits Under Fire in N.C.A.A.
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 2 (AP)The National Collegiate Athletic Association's new rule on squad limits for football teams is under fire.

title: 186 Top Scientists Dismiss Astrologers as Charlatans
description: Astrology, the ancient belief that stars influence people's lives and foretell events, has become so widely accepted that 186 prominent scientists have issued a statement calling astrologers charlatans and asserting that there is no rational basis for the belief.

title: LISBON ARMY HEAD OPPOSES PRORED
description: LISBON, Sept. 2The head of the Portuguese Army, followed the head of the Air Force today in opposing the appointment of Gen. Vasco Goncalves as chief of staff of the armed forces.

title: Hint of Autumn Chases Summer Doldrums
description: The leaves are still green on the trees in Bryant Park on 42d Street, but around the city, women have started wearing sweaters slung across their shoulders  shoulders that until recently went bare. The autumn breezes are approaching.

title: Red Smith
description: The first 20game winner of the baseball season, by a day and a half, has one leg longer than the other and a medical history longer than both. Next winter when plaques, loving cups and medals are being handed out at sports dinners, somebody should salute James Alvin Palmer of the Baltimore Orioles as the comeback player of the century, for never in memory has an athlete overcome adversity more often than Jim. His record in the Baseball Register is freckled with asterisks, daggers, squiggles and dingbats calling attention to footnotes, On disabled list, reads the note for 1967, from July 3 through Aug. 8. For 1968: Recalled by Baltimore and placed on disabled list for remainder of season, Aug. 28. For 1969: On disabled list from June 29 to Aug. 9. For 1974: On disabled list, June 20 to Aug. 13.

title: Faithful Swordfish Lovers Pay Dearly for the Luxury
description: Swordfish fanciers complain of high prices, Canadian fishermen seek other prey, fishmongers are bitter, Food and Drug officials are adamant. The swordfish themselves are probably delighted, and so are the fishermen of Gloucester and New Bedford, Mass.

title: OffStage Violence
description: The most disconcerting aspect of the report that a teenage gang roamed Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum during a rock concert last weekend, robbing many in the audience and injuring some, was that no arrests were made. Such flagrant lawlessness in a crowded auditorium during a public performance, without police protection for the victims, constitutes a dismal surrender to hoodlums.

title: Excerpts From Iranian's Speech to U.N. Session
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y.. Sept. 2Following are excerpts from an address to the General Assembly toda?? by Jamshid Amouzeg?? Iran's Interior Minister:

title: De Valera Buried Amid Irish Heroes
description: DUBLIN, Ireland, Sept. 2 (AP) Eamon de Valera was buried today in the shadow of Daniel O'Connell's towering tombstone and just a few graves awhy from Charles Stewart Parnell, Arthur Griffith, Michael Collins and other Irish heroes.

title: 2 Unions Open Campaign For Coast Farm Workers
description: FRESNO, Calif., Sept. 2Amid a growing threat of violence, the United Farm Workers and the International Brotherhood of Teamsters opened their battle today to win the first set of elections to be held under the state's new Farm Labor Election Law, the first of its kind in the nation.

title: Fillol Unnerved by Death Threat
description: A recent threat against his life has become more unnerving for Jaime Fillol than drop shots or overheads by rivals in the United States Open tennis championships.

title: Article 1  No Title
Market Place
description: Several big borrowers last month decided to delay bond. sales in the belief that interest rates will decline this fall. However, onethe European Investment Bankcanceled a $100million note sale last week because it could cut its cost right away.

title: Memorial Services
description: WIRENAlexis. Memorial services will be held in Russian Orthodox Cathedral of Our Lady of Sign, 93d and Park Ave. on Thursday, Sept. 4th at 7 P.M. His grieving brother George and niece Vera Wiren. The deceased had no children.

title: Holiday in Hanoi: Glorious Spring Victory Is Praised
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Sept. 2 North Vietnam today celebrated the 30th anniversary of its declaration of independence as hundreds of thousands of people thronged Hanoi's main square to hear Premier Pham Van Dong praise the glorious spring victory.

title: $750,000 in Art Objects Is Stolen Here
description: Jade and other objects worth at least $750,000 were stolen from the East Side home of a New York investment banker during the long Labor Day weekend, the police reported last night.

title: KISSINGER GAINS BACKING OF SAUDIS
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 2Secretary of State Kissinger received Saudi Arabia's endorsement of the new Egyptian

title: Phils Lose Fourth Straight
description: Jim Dwyer's tworun double in the third inning led the Montreal Expos to a 43 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies last night in Philadelphia. It was the fourth straight loss for the Phillies.

title: MELL DANIEL, 75, PAINTER, IS DEAD
description: Mell Daniel, one of the early American avantgarde painters who were rediscovered in the nineteenseventies after an absence of several decades from the art world, died Monday at his home in Tomkins Cove, N.Y. He was 75 years old.

title: W.F.L. Drops Chicago Club
description: The World Football League membership was down to 10 clubs today after the Chicago Winds: franchise was revoked by the league.

title: Some Miners Back; Fine Against Union Is Set at $800,000
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Sept. 2 (AP)Wildcat strikes by coal miners ended in several states today, but 30,000 miners in southern West Virginia began a fourth week on the picket lines and mines in eastern Kentucky remained shut.

title: Arthur Stratton, 65, Dead; Wrote About Madagascar
description: Arthur Stratton, a writer, died of cancer Monday in Washington Hospital Center. He was 65 years old and lived in Washington.

title: Become Plans to Dismantle All 9 City Superagencies
description: As part of a vast reorganization of city government, the Beame administration has decided to dismantle all of the nine superagencies set up by former Mayor John V. Lindsay.

title: About New York
description: A few uniformed stewards, jackets unbuttoned, walked into the bar of the Olympic Restaurant at 49th Street and 12th Avenue shortly before their ship, the Swedish cruise liner Kungsholm, was to sail from the new passenger terminal across the street. A dungareed shipmate went a few doors down, into Jose's Shop to buy some knicknacks. For a few minutes 12th Avenue, a gloomy waterfront artery under the West Side Highway, recaptured some of the flavor of the days when it was the springboard for most voyagers between the United States and Europe.

title: Dacca Red Cross Aide Is Held on Graft Charge
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Sept. 2 (AP)Authorities reported today the arrest of the former Red Cross chairman, Gazi Ghulam Mostafa, who had been sought since the Aug. 15 coup against the President. Sheik Muiibur Rahman.

title: ...U.S. Commitment
description: For Americans, the most significant element is the sizable new and still only partly revealed degree of direct United States involvement in the Middle East. Already some Congressmenstill under the shock of Vietnamare protesting the planned stationing of 200 Americans in the Sinai mountain passes as the beginning of a major and possibly dangerous military obligation. President Ford has sought to reassure Americans that the risks involved in assigning these civilian volunteers will be minimal. He has also stressed that they are a vital ingredient in convincing both sides that the agreement will be kept.

title: Nastase Tops Ramirez in 5Set Battle
Eastern Jet Fills With Smoke; New York Flight Interrupted
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Sept, 2(AP)An Eastern Airlines jumbo jet filled with smoke and depressurized suddenly moments after takeoff Tuesday, forcing the pilot to make an emergency landing.

title: SportsBet Bill Assailed By Athletes
description: BOSTON, Sept. 2Legalized betting on sports events, Coach Toni Heinsohn of the Boston Celtics said today, would place as unfair and undesirable a burden on athletes as it would on people in any other profession that would be involved in wagering.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold prices Monday.

title: Seaver's Pitching Statistics Stand Up to All Comparisons
description: To a statistical purist, Tom Seaver's major league record of eight consecutive seasons with 200 or more strikeouts is subject to challenge. All eight of Seaver's seasons came during an era of 162game schedules spread over 26 weeks; the two men who shared the record at seven consecutive seasons, Walter Johnson and Rube Waddell, pitched in 154game schedules over 24 weeks.

title: Motorcycle Rider Killed
description: DOUGLAS, Isle of Man, Sept. 2 (Reuters)Brian McComb, an Irish rider, was killed in a crash today during the Manx 250 cubic centimeter Grand Prix motorcycle race. McComb, a 24yearold motorcycle mechanic from Northern Ireland, crashed at high speed at Barregarrow, one of the fastest parts of the Isle of Man tourist trophy course.

title: EMIL RIOLO
description: Emil Riolo, associate production manager of The New Yorker magazine for the last 11 years, died Monday night of a heart attack in his home in Noroton, Conn. He was 60 years old.

title: 250,000 in Trenton Area Waterless as Pumps Fail
description: TRENTON, Sept. 2Much of this capital city and its surrounding communities ran out of water this evening after the city's watersupply plant broke down.

title: ETHIOPIA CONTINUING PEASANT EDUCATION
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Sept. 2 (Agence FrancePresse) Ethiopia's military rulers have ordered students to continue educating the country's peasants until June, 1976, the Addis Ababa radio reported in an Amharic language broadcast.

title: Tennis for the Big and Clumsy
description: Persons who are big, heavy and clumsy usually shy away from the tennis court, and usually with good reason. They don't want to feel embarrassed, especially when those playing on the next court appear to be graceful and proficient.

title: Lebanese Death Toll Rises To 34 in Sectarian Clashes
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 2 (AP)Ten more bodies were found in eastern Lebanon today, raising to 34 the death toll in a weeklong series of clashes between leftist Moslems and rightwing Christians, the police reported.

title: Haughton Expects U. S. Curb on Payments
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept 2 Daniel J. Haughton, chairman of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation, which has admitted making payments of at least $22million to foreign government officials and political parties, feels that the United States Government undoubtedly will adopt regulations restricting such payments.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (Reuters)The Federal Open Market Committee voted to maintain prevailing bank reserve and money market conditions at its meeting on July 15 provided growth in monetary aggregates appeared to be slowing substantially after the secondquarter bulge.

title: SOVIET'S DEFICIT WITH WEST GROWS
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 2The Soviet Union is running a mounting deficit in its trade with Western countries so far this year, according to statistics made available by Western commercial sources.

title: Next to schav, the most famous soup in the world containing sorrel is the French potage Germiny. It is one of the absolute marvels of soupdom and can be eaten hot or cold.
description: Next to schav, the most famous soup in the world containing sorrel is the French potage Germiny. It is one of the absolute marvels of soupdom and can be eaten hot or cold.

title: Appeal Filed for Retrial of Rubin Carter
description: Charging that the Passaic County Prosecutor's Office engaged in massive suppression of evidence, lawyers for Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artie yesterday asked the App??llate Division of the New Jersey Superior Court to grant a new trial in the 1966 triplemurder case.

title: Carey Visits Ford, But U.S. Aid to City Appears No Closer
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2President Ford and Governor Carey met for 45 minutes this evening for what the Governor termed a hearttoheart discussion of New York City's fiscal crisis, but the two men emerged from the Oval Office with differing versions of the substance of the conversation.

title: F.B.I. Agent Says Lynch Told Of Key Role in Bronfman Case
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Sept. 2Testimony by an agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation today indicated that Mel Patrick Lynch had admitted playing the major role in the kidnapping of Samuel Bronfman 2d, the heir to the Seagram liquor fortnne.

title: Beame Transfers Job of Civil Defense Office
description: In another of his promised economies by streamlining government operations, Mayor Beame issued an executive order yesterday eliminating the Office of Civil Defense for an annual savings estimated at $175,000.

title: SIMON CAUTIONS ON OILPRICE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2The United Staterwith little overt support from the other industrialized countriesemphasized today that another increase in the world price of oil would seriously jeopardize the balance upon which global economic recovery depends.

title: Slain Auxiliary Is Given a Police Funeral
description: David Freed, the first auxiliary policeman here to be killed while on duty, was given a Police Department funeral yesterday while his comrades, gathering six deep outside the Riverside Funeral Chapel, asked whether he had died in vain.

title: LISBON ARMY HEAD OPPOSES PRORED
description: LISBON, Sept. 2The head of the Portuguese Army followed the head of the Air Force today in opposing the appointment of Gen. Vasco Gonalves as chief of staff of the armed forces.

title: Gold Futures Fall In I.N.F. Reaction
description: Gold speculators sold futures heavily yesterday, with prices on the Commodity Exchange here dropping the $10anounce daily limit. The selling came in reaction to the International Monetary Fund's decision, announced over the weekend, to sell as much as 25 million ounces of gold, with the idea of lessening the metal's international role.

title: FIRE OFFICERS WIN A NEW 2YEAR PACT
description: The city and the Uniformed Fire Officers Association agreed yesterday to a new twoyear contract, retroactive to July 1, 1974, that would provide an immediate 8 per cent pay increase for the first year and a 6 per cent rise for the second year, according to union officials.

title: A Key to Sinai Pact: Electronics
description: The emphasis in the Israeli Egyptian agreement on earlywarning systems in the Sinai Pentrisula has focused attention on new dimensions of weaponry, among them devices that enable radar to peer beyond the horizon or helicopterborne people sniffers to detect a sweating infantry platoon movling to attack.

title: Australia to Buy Cocos Islands, A Feudal Indian Ocean Domain
description: CANBERRA, Australia. Sept. 2The Australian Government has decided to buy the 27 Cocos Islands from the family that has ruled them for nearly a century and a half.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Tuesday.

title: Artifacts May Block Carolina Power Project
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 R?? L. Edmiston, North Caro?? Attorney General, will appear before the Federal Court of Appeals here this fall in his slate's battle to block construction of a giant hydroelectric rower project on the New River

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Default: The How Is Still Not Clear
description: If New York City defaults, no one is sure what would happen or how creditors might be satisfied.

title: More Births Ahead
description: Two California demographers have published a study suggesting that the longrun decline in the American birth rate may have bottomed out, at least for the time being, and that a miniboom in natality may be ahead. The evidence suggests they deserve a respectful hearing. In the late nineteenfifties about 4.3 million babies were born annually; by 1973 this was down to 3.14 million babies. Then in 1974 the number of new babies increased, and in the first half of 1975 the upward trend gained strength.

title: Veterans Hospital in Michigan To Resume Regular Surgery
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Sept. 2Officials at the Veterans Administration Hospital here announced today that they would begin admitting patients and performing regular surgery again, 15 days after both practices were halted because of a mysterious rise in respiratory and cardiac arrests since July 1.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY; NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK SLATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: ...Will Congress Act?
description: If Congress is to respond to these contradictory economic pressures, it has to be at once more ambitious and more selfdisciplined. Its most urgent task is to break the yearlong impasse with the Ford Administration on energy policy. There is abundant blame to be shared by both sides, but it is now within Congress's power to move toward a solution.

title: Keeping a Stiff but Hairy Upper Lip
description: Hardly anyone knew it, ??ot even those with the hairiest upper lips. Yesterday was National Mustache Day.

title: Murray Davis, a Chairman At Lincoln High, Dies at 60
description: Murray S. Davis, chairman of the social studies department at Abraham Lincoln High School, Brooklyn, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home, 51 Webster Avenue, Malverne, L.I. He was 60 years old.

title: 250,000 in Trenton Area Waterless as Pumps Fail
description: TRENTON, Sept. 2Much of this capital city and its surrounding communities ran out of water this evening after the city's watersupply plant broke down.

title: Mohawk Data Has Turnaround in Net
People Refuse to Panic As the Water Runs Out
description: TRENTON, Sept. 2Slowly, but inexorably, water was running out here tonight, there was no sign of panic or any evidence of rampant hoarding.

title: Giants Waive Five Players
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Sept. 2  The New York Giants cut five players today to get their official roster down to the maximum, of 49 required at 4 P.M. Bill Arnsparger, the head coach, announced two of his waivers but kept the three others a secret between himself and the National Football League office.

title: COAST CAPTIVEDIES; 2 ARE STILL HOSTAGE
description: SOUTH LAKE TAHOE. Calif.. Sept. 2 (AP)One hostage was killed and a police detective was wounded today by two armed men who barricaded themselves inside an apartment here.

title: Talks on in Airline Strike
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (AP) Negotiators for National Airlines and the carrier's striking flight attendants met today in unsuccessful negotiating sessions and planned further talks for tomorrow.

title: U.S. Nursing Homes Termed No. 1 Fire Hazard by Senators
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2A Senate subcommittee that has been making a longterm investigative study of nursing homes released today a report declard ing this country's nursingi homes to be No. one on any list of unsafe places from the point of fire safety.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Juniors on Court In Tourney Today
description: Chris Lewis of New Zealand and Natasha Chmyreva of the Soviet Union are the topseeded players in the PepsiCola junior international tennis championships, which start today at the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills.

title: SADAT WILL VISIT FORD NEXT MONTH AFTER YEAR DELAY
description: CAIRO, Sept. 2President Anwar elSadat announced today that he would fly to Washington late next month for talks with President Ford to follow up yesterday's conclusion of a secondstage EgyptianIsraeli disengagement agreement in Sinai.

title: Books of The Times
description: Hans Herlin's novel Commemorations ?? a subterranean expedition into the dark unspeakable past. The middleaged people in it talk of how necessary it is to forget, the young are innocently curious, and the guilty shrill their innocence or beg the ultimate forgetfulness: death. It is Germany, 1969.

title: Namath to Start on Sunday
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Sept. 2 The Jets unveiled a darkhaired, green  eyed stoopshouldered quarterback today who calls himself Joe Namath. He was nominated by Coach Charley Winner to start Sunday's nationally televised game against the Redskins at Washington.

title: Coaches to Protest Cuts
description: Public Schools Athletic League football coaches will demonstrate Friday morning at the Board of Education and City Hall to protest the elimination of junior varsity football and other cuts in the football program caused by the city's financial crisis. The P.S.A.L. budget cut, which amounted to almost $1million from a former allocation of $2.4million, also brought about the elimination of junior varsity activity in baseball and basketball, indoor track, girls' intramurals and three minor sports.

title: An Irish Family on Beacon Hill? CBS Terms It Poetic License
description: BOSTON, Sept. 2  Beacon Hill? Jackie Walsh was saying. They put an Irish guy on Beacon Hill?

title: M.A.C. PLAN SEEKS TORESTRUCTURE CITY FINANCIALLY
description: A stringent plan that would restructure the city financially, providing for the possibility of municipal default and virtually erasing, the budgetary powers of the Mayor, was sent to Governor Carey and legislative leaders yesterday by the Municipal Assistance Corporation.

title: Iran Replies Skeptically To U.S. Economic Offers
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept. 2Iran, stung by United States criticisms of the oilproducing countries, gave a skeptical response in the General Assembly today to Secretary of State Kissinger's new proposals for bridging the economic gap between rich and poor countries.

title: Charging a Suppression of Evidence, Carter's Lawyers Ask for a Retrial
description: Charging that the Passaic County Prosecutors' Office engaged in massive suppression of evidence, lawyers for Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis yesterday asked the Appellate Division of the New Jersey Superior Conrt to grant a new trial in the 1966 triplemurder case.

title: Weekly Market Basket
description: The cost of feeding a family of four in New York City dropped last week by a small amount, 21 cents, 0.3 per cent below the total of the week before, the New York City Department of Consumer Affairs reported yesterday.

title: Reds 10, Padres 4
description: AT CINCINNATI  Tony Prez became the Reds' career runsbattedin king when he drove home Cesar Geronimo during a sevenrun fifth. The r.b.i. was the 1,010th for Perez and topped the previous mark of 1,009 by Frank Robinson, now manager of the Cleveland Indians. Don Gullett was the winning pitcher, his ninth victory in a row.

title: Court Backs Army On Drug Searches Without Warrants
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (AP) The Army does not need warrants to search for drugs among United States soldiers stationed in Europe, the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia ruled today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Three Queens men spotted crossing the East River in a yellow rubber raft on Monday night were arrested by a police harbor unit after they had broken into abandoned buildings on North Brother Island. according to the police. The three suspectsJohn Taylor, 25 years old, and his brother, Lloyd, 28, both of Bayside, and Louis McKenny, 29, of Beechhurstwere hooked on charges of burglary, criminal trespassing and possession of burglar's tools, The police said the three were apparently after valuable copper piping and plumbing fixtures.

title: Imetal Is Planning A Copperweld Bid
description: Socit Imetal, a French holding company with subsidiaries that mine and process various minerals and Europe's largest producer of nickel. said yesterday that it intended to make a tender offer for all of the outstanding cornmon shares of the Copperweld Corporation of Pittsburgh at $42.50 a share. Copperweld, a manufacturer of alloy steel and specialty tubing, has 2,464,687 common shares outstanding.

title: Hint of Autumn Chases Summer Doldrums
description: The leaves are still green on the trees in Bryant Park on 42d Street, but around the city, women have started wearing sweaters slung across their shouldersshoulders that until recently went bare. The autumn breezes are approaching.

title: Carey Visits Ford, But U.S. Aid to City Is Called No Closer
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2President Ford and Governor Carey met for 45 minutes this evening for what the Governor (termed a hearttoheart discussion of New York City's fiscal crisis, but the two men, emerged from the Oval Office with differing versions of the substance of the conversation.

title: FORD BARS STRIKE BY 4 RAIL UNIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (AP)  President Ford named a threemember emergency board today to investigate a labor dispute affecting four railroad unions, and ordered a 60day cooling off period.

title: 58 ARE ARRESTED AT ROCK CONCERT
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 2Guard dogs and tear gas were brought into action today by security guards and the state police to drive back fans trying to storm their way into a rock music concert at the State Fair Grounds here.

title: Getting Good Start in School
description: To get firstgraders off to a good start, Dr. Stella Chess suggests mothers make an appointment to visit the school to see what kind of clothing and conduct is customary. This way a child won't feel like a misfit if she shows up in jeans and Tshirt, only to see her classmates in dresses.

title: 2 NASSAU OPTIONS ON A GOVERNMENT
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Sept. 2The Nassau County Board of Supervisors voted today to offer county residents in November the choice of two types of government to replace the present form, which has been declared unconstitutional.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LUNCHTIME LISTENING Summer has not yet departed, and that means, among other things, that there's still a good deal of outdoor music available for luncheoning New Yorkers and the commuters. Chamber music fans can listen to the Metropolitan Brass Quintet, with Arthur Goldstein, today at the City University of New York Graduate Center's mall, on 42d Street between Fifth Avenue and the Avenue of the Americas, from 12:15 to 1:30 P.M. For further information: 7904395.

title: Khashoggi Admits He Pocketed a Bribe Intended for Officer
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (UPI) Adnan Khashoggi, the entrepreneur, has admitted he pocketed a bribe that the Northrop Corporation wanted to give the commanding general of the Saudi Arabian Air Force.

title: MEANY DEFENDS BOYCOTT ON GRAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 George Meany, apparently stung by criticism of the union boycott of grain shipments to the Soviet Union, declared today that the boycott would help family farmers as well as workers and consumers and that the A.F.L.C.I.O. would continue to support it.

title: Football Injuries Kill 2 15YearOlds
description: Two high school football players have died after collpasing during preseason practice. Lonnie Lowell Mastrud, 15 years old, died yesterday after being injured during a practice session last Friday at Bend High School in Great Bend, Ore. Mastrud struck his head on the ground during a tackling drill and collapsed on the sidelines. He was taken to the hospital where his breathing stopped, but it was restored with a respirator. He never regained consciousness.

title: Linda Lee, 35, Lawyer, Dies; Expert on the Constitution
description: Linda K. Lee, a specialist in legislative and constitutional law, died Saturday of a liver ailment in Washington. Miss Lee, who was 35 years old, lived and practiced in the capital.

title: Official Reserves Fell In Britain Last Month
description: LONDON, Sept. 2 (Reuters) Britain's official reserves of gold and foreign currency fell $255million last month to their lowest level since February 1974.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Iran, stung by United States criticisms of the oilproducing countries, responded skeptically in the United Nations to Secretary of State Kissinger's new proposals for bridging the economic gap between rich and poor countries. Jamshid Amouzegar, Minister of the Interior, told the General Assembly that proposals may appear brilliant on paper, but how they are implemented, that is the question. Delegates from developing countries gave his speech widespread applause but their prevailing mood continued favorable to the statement from Mr. Kissinger. [Page 1, Columns 12.]

title: WINE TALK
description: In the continuing discussion about the high prices many restaurants charge for wine, one group has been overlooked: the restaurants where wine may be brought in, either from home or a nearby liquor store.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Look what opening the door to Peking has set in motion. First acupuncture became chic: Then came a wave of clothes inspired by the Chinese Army and the workers in the fields. Hairdressers began snipping bangs and makeup was used to make women look like Chinese dolls. Paris picked up coolie jackets, frog closings and drawstring pants. This fall, most of our own Seventh Avenue is bowing to the East.

title: People and Business
description: Gen. Mohammed Mahgoub, head of the Arab League's antiIsrael boycott commission, said in Cairo yesterday that Volkswagen and the British Lonrho Group have been given six months to meet requirements for getting their names off the league's boycott list.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 3, 1975

title: Queens Man Jumps to Death
description: An unidentified man about 50 years old jumped to his death yesterday from an apartment building at 3720 83d Street, Elmhurst, Queens.

title: Pele Scores Twice In Cosmos' Victory
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, Sept. 2 (UPI)Pel scored two goals within five minutes tonight to give the New York Cosmos a 31 victory over an allstar Swedish team in an exhibition soccer match before 20,448 fans. The game was scoreless at halftime.

title: 35% Rise in U.S. Auto Output Is Expected During September
description: DETROIT, Sept. 2American auto production in September is expected to climb to 677,000 units, up 35 per cent from August, according to industry trade services.

title: About Education
description: Schools and colleges begin opening for a new year this week, and the lesson for educators and administrators this fall will concern the problems of fewer students and higher costs.

title: Cambodian Villages Bare as People Work Fields
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Sept. 2Two villages on the road to Battambang in neighboring Cambodia were descried as a visitor from Sri Lanka passed through them last week.

title: Problems Harass Schools in the Suburbs
description: Public schools in most of the suburbs in the New York metropolitan area are scheduled to reopen today. But this academic year is getting under way against a backdrop of budget defeats, austerity programs, cutbacks in staff, a continuing decline in enrollment, and the ??ossibility of an unusually high number of strikes by teachers ??ver salary demands.

title: Taylor Resigns Post
description: MOBILE, Ala., Sept 2 (AP) Jim Taylor, head basketball coach at the University of South Alabama the last five years, resigned today to go into business.

title: Ecuador, Coup Crushed, Imposes Curfew
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Sept. 2 (UPI)  President Guillermo Rodriguez Lara imposed a curfew today and ordered mass arrests of civilian politicians who supported a coup that was crushed by loyal commanders yesterday.

title: Advertising
description: John E. O'Toole, poet, book reviewer, lover of the language and, incidently, an ad agency president, recently finished reading a copy of Time (having paid strict attention to the ads) and exclaimed, Thank God, long copy is coming back.

title: ROSSETTI, ALBANO WIN LEGAL ROUND
description: Frank G. Rossetti and Vincent F. Albano, the Democratic and Republican leaders of Manhattan, were assured yesterday of reelection to their district leadership posts when the State Court of Appeals in Albany declined to hear appeals by their opponents in the Sept. 9 primary from lowercourt rulings disqualifying the opponents.

title: Girl Killed in Explosion
description: HERNANDO, Miss., Sept. 2 (UPI)A 17yearold girl was killed today in a series or exposions and fires that shattered two houses and heavily damaged a gasoline storage facility and a nearby propane gas compay. Killed was Ruby White, eight other persons were injured.

title: GOLD PRICE SETS LOW FOR A YEAR
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 2 (UPI)The price of gold plummeted today to its lowest level in more than a year in reaction to the decision by the International Monetary Fund to sell one sixth of its gold reserves at market prices to aid developing nations.

title: Contract Awards
description: The New York State Power Authority has placed orders for turbine generators, costing $72million, with the General Electric Company and with the Foster Wheeler Energy Corporation for the $53million boiler for the fossilfired electric incinerating plant it plans to build.

title: Pessimism Rises in Talks To Avert Teacher Strike
description: School and union negotiators were described yesterday as far apart on key contract issues as pessimism mounted over, chances that a city teachers' strike threatened for next Tuesday could still be averted.

title: Ways to Enjoy a Versatile, LittleKnown Herb
description: A long time ago we developed a theory that most people who truly care about what they eat fall into two groups, those who invariably save the tastiest tidbit (the heart of watermelon, for example) for the very last bite; and those who gobble up the most flavorsome morsel of a dish at the moment of sitting down to dine.

title: A War Cry of Feminists Echoed by Mrs. Gandhi
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 2Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, who as one of the world's most powerful women has often been lionized by feminists, showed today that she had been paying attention to what they have been saying.

title: 5 Schools Struck
description: Lay teachers in five Roman Catholic high schools in Brooklyn and Queens, enrolling 8,000 pupils, voted to go on strike today. Page 34.

title: Cubs 5, Cardinals 3
description: AT ST. LOUISTwo errors by the St. Louis second baseman, Larry Lintz, helped Chicago snap a 11 tie with a pair of runs in the seventh. Lintz dropped Jerry Morales's pop fly in short right to start the seventh. Morales moved to third on Andy Thornton's long drive to right and scored when Lintz threw wildly to the plate on a grounder by Manny Trillo. Steve Swisher beat out an infield hit, and an errant pickoff throw by Lynn McGlothen sent Trillo to third, where he scored on a balk.

title: 40% RATE INCREASE SOUGHT BY UTILITY
description: NEWARK, Sept. 2 (UPI)The Jersey Central Power & Light Company, which received a rate increase in June, filed a request today for a $139million rate rise which would add $9.80 to the average customer's bill, which now is $21.56.

title: Maurice Becker, 86, Dies; Painter and WaterColorist
description: Maurice Becker, a painter and watercolorist, died of pneumonia last Thursday at the Jewish Home of Eastern Pennsylvania in Scranton. He was 86 years old.

title: So That Baby Can Bounce
description: It may be an old American custom to pose for baby pictures on a bearskin rug, but an Australian infant is most likely to be photographed in his or her Bouncinette.

title: Forest Fire in California Contained After Six Days
description: PORTERVILLE, Calif., Sept. 2 (AP)California's worst forest fire of the season was contained today after blackening 15,650 acres of brush and limberenough to build 500 three bedroom homes.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Details of M.A.C. Plan
description: The $2billion plan detailed yesterday by the Municipal Assistance Corporation would match borrowings from various sources with the city's cash requirements month by month for September. October and November.

title: PROF. ENRICO JOSI, ARCHEOLOGIST, 90
description: ROME, Sept. 2Prof. Enrico Josi, the worldrenowned specialist in Christian archeology who discovered the tomb of St. Peter underneath the Vatican Basilica, died here yesterday. He was 90 years old.

title: French Finance Chief Sees No Rush to Gold
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2JeanPierre Fourcade, the French Finance Minister, said here today that the Bank of France would not rush to the market to buy gold once the gold agreement among the 10 leading industrial countries, reached Sunday, comes into effect.

title: ISRAELI BE GLUM ABOUT NEXT STEPS
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 2Defense Minister Shimon Peres said today that at best negotiations with Syria were months off and a resolution of the Palestinian issue a matter of years and years.

title: ISRAELI PLANES RAID SOUTH LEBANON AREA
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 2 (AP)Israeli planes bombed and strafed a suspected Arab guerrilla base in a sparsely populated region of southeastern Lebanon today, the military command said.

title: U.S. to Provide 2 Planes to Aid In Refugee Airlift From Angola
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2The United States will provide two chartered planes to evacuate Portuguese refugees from Angola over the next two months.

title: $750,000 Theft Here
description: Jade and other objects valued at $750.000 were reported stolen from the East Side home of Paul E. Manheim, an investment banker. Page 40.

title: Drive Reported Repulsed
description: LUANDA, Angola, Sept. 2 (Agence FrancePresse)Troops of the Marxist Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola have pushed back an advance by the rival National Front for the Liberation of Angola that had reached to within 12 miles of Luanda, reliable sources said here today.

title: Red Sox Set Back Yankees
KEY ISSUES ARISE IN GANDHI CASE
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 2In the ornate woodpaneled Supreme Court chambers here, with ceiling fans whirring noisily overhead, lawyers for and against Prime Minister Indira Gandhi are struggling laboriously through a case that some of them regard as crucial to the future of the Indian democracy.

title: Fare Rise Brings Anger, Shrugs, TurnstileJumping and Arrests
description: The vast majority of New Yorkers trooping back to work yesterday gave the new 50cent transit fare a shrug or a snarl, and a few of them42 by early eveningwere arrested in scat tered gatecrashing incidents.

title: U.S. Budget Deficit Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (Reuters)The United States had a $11.05billion Federal budget deficit in July, the Treasury Department reported. Receipts totaled $20.2billion and outlays were $31.25billion. The Treasury said $7.8billion of the deficit was covered by borrowing from the public $4.76billion by reduction of cash and monetary assets, and $1.51billion by other means.

title: Sinai Accord Wins Vote in Rabin Party By a 3704 Margin
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 2The Central Committee of Israel's governing Labor party tonight overwhelmingly approved the interim Sinai agreement with Egypt following a confrontation between Premier Yitzhak Rabin and former Defense Minister Moshe Dayan, who attacked the accord.

title: Pentagon Role Reported In '70 Plot Against Allende
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2The Defense Department ordered the United States military attach in Chile to give strong covert support to an October, 1970, plan for a military coup aimed at keeping Salvador Allende Gossens out of the Chilean presidency, sources familiar with the operation reported today.

title: HalfFare Bus Ride for Jobless Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 Continental Trailways, Inc., the nation's secondlargest longdistance bus system, announced today that anyone who can show proof of unemployment will be given a 50 per cent fare discount.

title: Text of M.A.C. Letter to Carey
description: Following is the text of the letter from the Municipal Assistance Corporation to Governor Carey accompanying the M.A.C. plan to raise money for the city:

title: Dahlia Is Invited Again To Laurel's International
description: LAUREL, Md.. Sept. 2 (AP) Nelson Bunker Hunt's champion mare, Dahlia, has been invited to the 24th Washington, D. C. International, John D. Schapiro, president of Laurel Race Course, site of the International national on Nov. 8, issued the invitation following Dahlia's recent Gold Cup victory at York, England. Schapiro made the formal announcement today.

title: Francis Okie, 95, Invented Sandpaper to Replace Razor
description: Francis G. Okie, who invented a sandpaper to replace the razor, died Monday at his home on Peninsula Road, Dellwood, Minn. He was 95 years old.

title: SADAT WILL VISIT FORD NEXT MONTH AFTER YEAR DELAY
description: CAIRO, Sept. 2President Anwar elSadat announced today that he would fly to Washington late next month for talks with President Ford to follow up yesterday's conclusion of a secondstage EgyptianIsraeli disengagement agreement in Sinai.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: A 1973 printed advertisement for Fleischmann's Margarine said that every 15 seconds a doctor recommends Fleischmann's Margarine and that a recent survey shows that twice as many doctors recommend Fleischmann's as any other margarine ...

title: City Banks Still Uncertain On M.A.C. Financing Plan
description: After a full day of meetings, top officials with the city's banks and brokerage houses failed to reach agreement on whether they could bear their share of the Municipal Assistance Corporation's proposed package of financing arrangements to avert a city default this month.

title: Haldeman Files Appeal of Watergate Verdict
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (AP)Lawyers for H. R. Haldeman appealed his Watergate coverup conviction today, saying that he had been tried in an atmosphere supersaturated with the utter assumption of guilt.

title: Corsicans Stage More Attacks, Criticize Colonial Treatment
description: BASTIA, Corsica, Sept. 2 (AP) Bombing and shooting attacks erupted early today following a 24hour general strike called by militant Corsicans in support of demands for autonomy.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: About New York
description: A few uniformed stewards, jackets unbuttoned, walked into the bar of the Olympic Restaurant at 49th Street and 12th Avenue shortly before their ship, the Swedish cruise liner Kungsholm, was to sail from the new passenger terminal across the street. A dungareed shipmate went a few doors down, into Jose's Shop to buy some knicknacks. For a few minutes 12th Avenue, a gloomy waterfront artery under the West Side Highway, recaptured some of the flavor of the days when it was the springboard for most voyagers between the United States and Europe.

title: TV: Lincoln and Roosevelt Legends
description: The power of television as mythandlegend machine is aimed this evening in the direction of two Presidents: Abraham Lincoln and Franklin Delano Roosevelt. At 9 on NBC, Lincoln is brought to electronic life through the magic of makeup and a Hal Holbrook performance. At 10 on CBS, the Roosevelt career and personality are pieced together with old photographs and film footage. In each case, with the nation's Bicentennial observances under way, the dominant mode is liberal reverence, which may not be inspiring but can be effectively comforting.

title: Key Teacher Issue
description: With lees than a week remaining before the expiration of the United Federation of Teachers' contract with the Board of Education, the negotiations to avert a strike appear stalled on the question of working conditions, no tably preparation periods. The union wants more, and the hoard wants fewer. Preparation period is a euphemism for free time for teachers. The hoard wants to reduce the free time and to make teachers accountable for what they do with it. The union, understandably, wants to increase the free time and would be just as happy to refer to it as free periods and drop any pretext about what the time is to be used for.

title: Economic Squeeze...
description: As Congress returns to work after its traditional August recess, it faces the same set of stubborn, interrelated economic problems that has troubled the nation for nearly a year. The challenge to both the legislators and President Ford is to cooperate more effectively in the search for solutions than they have thus far.

title: HOMOSEXUAL RIGHTS BACKED BY PARLEY
description: BOSTON, Sept. 2  Three hundred persons from around the country gathered here over the Labor Day weekend for a conference aimed at promoting a more positive view of homosexuals In the Roman Catholic Church.

title: In Memoriam
description: ALPERDavid J., September 3rd, 1970. His life was gentle, and the elements so mixed in him, that Nature might stand up and say to the world.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: After finishing the regular season in first place by a margin of 14 points in the six  team National Lacrosse League, the Long Island Tomahawks open their playoffs tonight in Nassau Coliseum against the Quebec Caribous, who finished fourth. The second game of the fourofseven game semifinal series will be played Friday night in Nassau Coliseum. Next week the competition moves to the Quebec City Coliseum for games on Tuesday and Thursday nights. If a fifth game is necessary the series will return to Nassau Coliseum. A sixth game would be in Quebec and a seventh game would be on Long Island.

title: BRITISH TO INCREASE FORCES IN ARMAGH
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sept. 2The British Secretary of State for Northern Ireland, Merlyn Rees announced emergency plans today for tighter security in the Armagh area, southwest of Belfast, after nine killings in 24 hours.

title: U.S. Reports Discovery Of Minerals in Alaska
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (AP) The Interior Department said today that significant mineral deposits had been found about two miles inside the western boundary of Alaska's proposed Noatak National Arctic Range.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: An International Chamber Music Festival will be held for the first time next year in the Berkshires. The series of concerts will begin in early September, probably on Labor Day weekend, and continue for at least two weeks. The ensembles and soloists who will perform will come from all over the world, with the festival bearing their costs while they are in this country. A hall has yet to be decided upon, but it will be in the nature of the Berkshire Playhouse in Stockbridge, Mass., or the chapel of the Cranwell School near Lenox, Mass.

title: Moritt Allowed to Press Claim Against Nadjari
description: The chief Federal judge in Brooklyn has upheld the right of Fred G. Moritt, a retired Civil Court judge and a songwriter, to press his claim of prosecutorial misconduct against Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state anticorruption prosecutor.

title: Spate of Ulster Killings Stirs Revulsion and Fear
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 31Two weeks ago Samuel Llewellyn, a Protestant, who was a maintenance worker, drove his truck to a Roman Catholic district to deliver hardboard for repairs to houses damaged in a bomb blast. After making his third delivery, he was surrounded by a mob, dragged from his truck and, shreiking with fear, was beaten and shot to death.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The six Monmouth county teenagers in Long Branch who broke the 22day, eighthour world record for Ferriswheel rides on Sunday plan to continue until Thursday to raise extra money for the March of Dimes. Neighbors pledged to give money for each successive ride. Each of the six children has spent at least 45 minutes of each hour for the last 24 days aboard the Ferris wheel at the Long Branch Amusement Park. The recordholders are Shirley Brandle, 13 years old, of Eatontown; Albert Koberlein, 16; Joey Della, 14, and Sharon Colfver, 14, all of Middletown, and Bertha Fuentes, 15, and Brian Shuski, 17, both of Long Branch.

title: Newark Steps Up Enforcement On Parking, Using Tow Trucks
description: NEWARK, Sept. 2 (UPI)The police began a rushhour ticketing sweep in the downtown business district today, followed by tow trucks that hauled away illegally parked vehicles.

title: Profit Taking Weakens Stocks in Light Trading
description: An early attempt to extend last week's rally in the stock market gave way yesterday under the weight of profit taking in comparatively light trading.

title: Ghana Gets Metric System
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Sept. 2 (Agence FrancePresse)  Ghana adopted the metric system this week after more than a century of using the imperial system of weights and measures.

title: Columbia Eleven Hits Hard in Drill
description: LAKESIDE, Conn., Sept. 2 After five days of nocontact drills at its Camp Columbia training site, the Lions' football team donned pads today, and the results were encouraging.

title: U.N. TO HOLD TALKS ON ITS SINAI ROLE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept. 2The United Nations was kept on the sidelines during the negotiations that led yesterday to the initialing of the agreements on disengagement in the Sinai Desert. But it will have an important role in carrying them out, and the accords will probably come under review by the Security Council.

title: Bridge:
description: A successful defense of a national title is rare indeed, hut this feat was achieved in Miami Beach a month ago by a foursome representing the Prudential insurance Company of Roseland, N. J.

title: New Attack in Malaysia Takes Big Police Toll
description: KUALA LUMPUR. Malaysia, Wednesday, Sept. 3 (Reuters)  Two policemen were killed and 40 were wounded today when guerrillas threw hand grenades into a crowded police canteen and nearby drill ground here, witnesses said.

title: Boston Mayor Favored for Election
description: BOSTON, Sept. 2  Despite a campaign by his opponent stressing a climate of corruption at City Hall, Mayor Kevin H. White is still heavily favored in an election campaign overshadowed by tension over impending courtordered busing for school desegregation.

title: The Network Circus
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2Another television season is about to begin. But like the annual changes in automobiles or the circus, only the details are new. There are three television networks as there are three major producers of automobiles or three rings at the circus. Each network competes fiercely against the other two, but the competition is only in trivia at the marginsa different face, a different formatsince all three have long since settled upon the least common denominator of popular taste and the most secure routes to pleasing it.

title: Congress to Debate Oil and the Mideast Upon Return Today
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2Congress will reconvene tomorrow after a monthlong recess and plans to begin deliberations at once on two pressing issues: the Middle East agreement negotiated by the Ford Administration and the price of oil.

title: Occidental Petroleum to Protest Libyan Plan to Cut Output of Oil
description: The Occidental Petroleum Corporation has said it will protest the Libyan Government order that Occidental reduce its oil production in that country by more than 50 per cent in September.

title: Governor's Fiscal Plan Seen in Trouble Even Before Session Starts
description: With no public commitments and increasing private qualms, the legislative leaders yesterday received their formal summons from Governor Carey to take up an emergency fiscal plan for the city that the Governor himself concedes as holding clear and definite levels of risk for the state.

title: Bridge:
description: A successful defense of a national title is rare indeed, but this feat was achieved in Miami Beach a month ago by a foursome repreesnting the Prudential Insurance Company of Roseland, N. J.

title: U.S. Bows in Volleyball
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Sept. 2 (UPI)The Soviet Union's men's volleyball team opened its tour of the Uinted States last night with a threegame sweep of a young Uinted States team. The Russians, who are favorites to capture the gold medal in the 1976 Olympic Games, beat the Americans 1512, 154, 1510.

title: Clemency Program Gets Wide Support In a Gallup Survey
description: President Ford's clemency program requiring alternative service of Vietnam draft evaders and deserters was strongly supported as a middleoftheroad approach in a recent Gallup poll, the polling organization said yesterday.

title: Scientists Scan Astrology, Find a Universe of Hokum
description: Astrology, the ancient belief that stars influence people's lives and foretell events, has become so widely accepted that 186 prominent scientists have issued a statement calling astrologers charlatans and asserting that there is no rational basis for the belief.

title: Notes on People
description: Joseph Woodrow Hatehett was sworn in yesterday as the first black State Supreme Court Justice in the postReconstruction South. Gov. Reubin Askew, who appointed him to the Florida court, was present at the ceremony in Tallahassee. Judge Hatchett, age 42 is a deputy United States Attorney and Federal magistrate. His father was a fruitpicker. His mother, Lula Hatchett, a former domestic worker, said at her son's investiture, I'm so happy that I feel like screaming and crying.

title: Traffic Fatalities For Long Weekend Lowest in 14 Years
description: The lowest traffic fatality toll in 14 years for a Labor Day weekend was reported yesterday.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE CUP

title: Stage: Kennedy's Children in London
description: LONDONThere are currently two British shows on Broadway and nine American shows in London's West End. So much for the British theater's conquest of America. The leasing and the lending go both ways.

title: A New C.C.C. for Cities
description: We have in our cities today a curious combination of problems. There are vast numbers of young people who are drifting aimlessly, whether they are in school or not; since there are few jobs, there is little they can do that seems meaningful or rewarding. At the same time, our cities have urgent, needs that go unmet because of a lack of adequate public resources. A comparable set of circumstances in the 1930's led the New Deal Administration of President Franklin Delano Roosevelt to create youth programs that in their essentials were more innovative and bold than anything that currently exists. Perhaps it is time to reconsider these programs to determine whether they offer models for the present.

title: Orders for Durable Goods Up in July; Steel Production Continues to Climb
description: Steel production for the week ended Aug. 30 continued its recovery and posted a 3.9 per cent gain as 2,038,000 tons were poured, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Price Is Reduced For Industrial Sugar By Four Refiners
description: Wholesale prices for industrial sugar were cut by 85 cents a hundred pounds yesterday by four refinersthe Amstar Corporation, CPC International, Inc.'s Corn Products subsidiary, the National Sugar Refining Company, and the Sucrest Corporation. The price change reduced the price for 100 pounds of extra fine granulated sugar to $23.90, and the price of two other industrial grades (bulk granulated and liquid No. 2) to $23.30 a hundred pounds.

title: SOHIO SUSPENDING POSTING OF PRICES
description: The Standard Oil Company (Ohio) announced yesterday that it had suspended posting prices Monday because of uncertainties over Federal price controls and import fees.

title: On Social Policy
description: MINNEAPOLISSince 1968 there has developed a broadly based critique of government's capacity for improving our lives. Phrases such as benign neglect, counterintuitive, and throwing dollars at problems characterize the rhetoric of this argument.

title: Beame Plans to Dismantle All 9 City Superagencies
description: As part of a vast reorganization of city government, the Beame administration has decided to dismantle all of the nine superagencies set up by former Mayor John V. Lindsay.

title: PRICES ARE LOWER ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market declined in light trading yesterday as investors continued to be cautious about the state of the economy.

title: Mets Outslugged by Pirates, 84, And Drop 5 Games Back in Race
Pickets Curb BacktoSchool Movement
description: Strikes by school teachers dissatisfied over contractsor the lack of contractshit dozens of communities across the country as the backtoschool movement got into full swing yesterday.

title: Dance Fills a Need With Longer Season
