description: ST. PAUL, Sept. 4 (AP) The Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing, Company, which has admitted it made Illegal political contributions in the United States, will disclose soon whether it also made any foreign gifts.

title: WARMTONED MUSIC BY PEANUTS HUCKO
description: The last time Peanuts Hucko was in town, a little more than a year ago, he was leading the Glenn Miller Orchestra, which might seem to be an odd position for a clarinetist (Mr. Miller was a trombonist) whose primary musical source was Benny Goodman, That arrangement did not last long and currently, at Michael's Pub. 211 East 55th Street, Mr. Hucko is back in the smallgroup setting in which he is most at ease.

title: Dow Chemical Dividend Up
description: The Dow Chemical Company announced yesterday a 14 per cent increase in its common stock dividend to 40 cents a share from 35 cents. The dividend is payable Oct. 30 to shareholders of record Sept. 30.

title: GROWTH RATE UP IN MONEY SUPPLY
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday that the nation's money supply had experienced its most rapid growth in more than five months in late August.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In some editions of The New York Times Wednesday, a headline reported incorrectly that Adnan Khashoggi, a Saudi Arabian businessman, said he had kept a Lockheed gift intended for a Saudi general. The gift was from the Northrop Corporation, Mr. Khashoggi said.

title: STATE TASK FORCE OFFERS WORK PLAN
description: A worksharing proposal by a task force appointed by Governor Carey  to keep workers on the job for fourday weeks supplemented by unemploymentinsurance benefits for the fifth daywas disclosed here yesterday.

title: ShortTerm Bills Sold By the U.S. Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 The Treasury Department auctioned today $1.5billion of shortterm bills consisting of $800million of 13day bills which mature Sept. 18, 1975 and $700million of 20day bills maturing Sept. 25, 1975.

title: Leading Southern Golf Scores
JAVITS ASKS CHANGE IN U.S. POLICY ON ASIA
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits called last night for a clarification and a redefinition of United States policy in Asia, including the disbanding of the Southeast Asia Treaty Organization.

title: Issue and Debate
description: Shall the fiscal, budget, audit and accounting changes proposed as amendments to Chapters 5, 6, 7, 9, 10, 51, 52 and 58 of the City Charter be adopted?

title: Niagara Crewman Dies Trying to Retrieve Raft
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y., Sept. 4 (AP)A man died today while trying to retrieve a rubber raft that capsized last week, drowning three of the 29 persons aboard.

title: U.S. Tells Schools They Must Assist ForeignSpeaking
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (UPI) The Government ordered today schools with children who speak little or no English to determine the languages spoken in their homes as a step toward eliminating discrimination against pupils with language problems.

title: The Pop Life
description: This observer spent his summer vacation learning to hustlethe dance, that is.

title: PRICES OF GRAINS MOVE NARROWLY
description: Gram and soybean futures closed yesterday with little changes. The commodities were up a few cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Dow Up 6.02
description: The stock market closed at its highest level of the day yesterday in slow trading.

title: China Expected to Become A Major Producer of Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4China appears to be moving toward becoming a major oilproducing nation, and the Ford Administration has reacted to this prospect by trying to discourage American oil companies from drilling in waters that the Chinese claim.

title: 22 Indicted in Bookmaking
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Sept. 4 (AP)A Federal grand jury indicted 22 persons in Alabama. Georgia and Nevada today on charges of operating a bookmaking network by using telephones to relay wagering information. Among those indicted was Sam Anselmo Fiorella of Birmingham, who was also indicted in June on charges of perjury and obstruction of justice.

title: Suffolk Law Enforcement Scored After New Charge
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Sept. 4Law enforcement is in chaos in Suffolk was a phrase used repeatedly here today as government officials and representatives of both major political parties reacted to charges of sex abuse filed against Henry F. O'Brien, the Suffolk County District Attorney, by, Eugent R. Kelley, the County, Police Commissioner.

title: Issue and Debate
description: When New York City residents enter the voting booth on Election Day, those words will confront them as the first of nine propositions to which they will be asked to answer Yes or No by pulling the appropriate lever.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Parking Rules Altered For Jewish Holidays
description: Traffic Commissioner Theodore Karagheuzoff announced yesterday that the following parking regulations would be suspended tomorrow, on the first day of Rosh haShanah, the Jewish New Year:

title: Fear City Revisited
description: Verbal excesses are a frequent, though regrettable, lastminute accompaniment of tense contract negotiations, but that dreary union tradition cannot justify the inflammatory demagoguery engaged in by Albert Shanker of the United Federation of Teachers as he predicts a year of waste and despair in the city's schools, then urges parents to flee both schools and city.

title: Shot Fatal to Hostage Linked To Police in Siege on Coast
description: SOUTH LAKE TAHOE, Calif., Sept. 4 (AP)  A hostage slain during an 18  hour siege was killed by pelets from a shotgun apparently fired by a police officer, the authorities said today after an autopsy.

title: Ford Urges Speedy Vote On American Role in Sinai
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 President Ford and Secretary of State Kissinger asked Congress today to approve the stationing of Americans in Sinai within two and a half weeks, stating the speedy action was necessary so the IsraeliEgyptian accord could go into effect.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SHOWTIME Broady's is the newest of several barrestaurants spotted along or near Columbus Avenue between 86th and 100th Streets in the highdensity, Upper West Side area, which is undergoing fitful urban renewal.

title: Business Briefs
description: The United Brands Company, which is fighting Government efforts to compel it to disclose the names of officials it bribed in Honduras and Italy, is expected to obtain a court ruling Sept. 11 on a request it made to transfer the Securities and Exchange Commission suit from Washington to Boston.

title: Big HardCover Harvest Is Forecast
description: Like school, the new publishing season begins after the summer hiatus. But unlike school, troubled by teachers' strikes, courtordered busing and budget cutbacks, the publishers exude radiant confidence.

title: People in Sports
description: Nolan Ryan, who led the major leagues in strikeouts the last three seasons, has bone chips in his right elbow and will not pitch any more this year.

title: Seniority Gained as Teachers No Help to LaidOil Counselors,
description: Last Friday Erwin Schussel, an elementaryschool guidance counselor in Brooklyn for the last five years, was notified by mail that he was among the 400 guidance counselors being laid off by the city school system because of the fiscal crisis.

title: Notes on People
description: For the third time the White House submitted to the Senate yesterday the nomination of Earl J. Silbert for confirmation as United States Attorney for the District of Columbia. The announcement was made aboard Air Force One as President Ford flew to the West Coast.

title: TEACHER STRIKES PLAGUE 11 STATES
description: Teachers in 11 states walked picket lines yesterday for more money and other demands. Nearly one million children thus had an extended summer vacation or dawdled the hours away in understaffed schools.

title: Ford Repeats Conservative Line In Speeches to G.O.P. on Coast
description: SEATTLE, Sept. 4President Ford declared at a Republican rally here today that he and the party should be prepared to govern, but not to dominate, the American people.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: KAJIWARAMrs. LeRoy (Hachie). A memorial service will be held at the Riverside Church, Riverside Drive and 122d St. on Sunday, Sept. 7, at 3 P.M. In lieu or flowers contributions may he made to the New York Heart Association.

title: NonUrgent 911 Calls Rising, Despite Urgent Police Plea
description: In the huge communications room at Police Headquarters here the other day, Sgt. Eugene J. McDonnell was patiently talking to a woman who had dialed 911 because her cat. had run up a tree.

title: Ford to Import a Minicar To Bolster Product Line
description: DETROIT, Sept. 4  Henry Ford 2d, the chairman of the Ford Motor Company, said today that his company would import a minicar from Europe to be introduced in this country in the spring of 1977 in order to strengthen Ford's product line in the growing smallcaf segment of the auto market.

title: FRANK A. ZUNINO JR
description: Frank A. Zunino Jr., a New York lawyer specializing in estates, trusts, taxes and similar matters, died yesterday at his home, 35 Raiders Lane, Darien, Conn. He was 79 years old.

title: BUTZ HINTS HALT IN SALES TO RUSSIA
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9Seccretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz indicated today that there would be no further grain sales! to the Soviet Union until a settlement is reached with labor unions now boycotting grain shipments to Russia.

title: Finding a Child Specialist
description: The field of pedodontics is growing fast. In 1963, there were only 100 pediatric dentists in the country. Today there are 1,200, but they still make up less than 1 per cent of dentistry, with a total of 125,000 dentists of all kinds. (By comparison, there are 360,000 medical doctors, 20,000 of whom, or just less than 5 per cent, are pediatricians.)

title: Wall St. Journal Urges Voluntary Bankruptcy
description: On the theory that the fiscal agony of New York City has gone beyond any other solution. The Wall Street Journal, in an editorial yesterday, recommended voluntary municipal bankruptcy.

title: CANDIDATE TO PAY COST OF FORD TRIP
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 President Ford and former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California can campaign in the special Senate election in New Hampshire this month without losing any spending power in the New Hampshire Presidential primary next March, the Federal Election Commission ruled today.

title: Widow, 75, Slain in Bronx; 4th Such Death in 6 Weeks
description: Four murders in six weeks in a quiet, middleclass section of the Bronx, the latest of which took place Wednesday, have left residents fearful and the police baffled by a lack of clues.

title: Portuguese Navy Siding With Goncalves
description: LISBON, Sept. 4The Portoguese Navy was reported today to have split with the army by siding with Gen. Vasco Goncalves in the critical fight over the plan to shift him from the premiership to the post of Chief of Staff of the armed forces.

title: ONE BANK SPURNS M.A.C. BOND SALE
description: The National Bank of North America was the only large bank here to refuse to join in a commitment to buy $100million worth of bonds to be sold this month by the Municipal Assistance Corporation, financial sources said yesterday.

title: 2 Football Players Found Innocent
description: ROSEBURG, Ore., Sept 4 (AP)Two National Football League players charged with rape were found innocent today by a jury in Douglas County Circuit Court. The jury deliberated 1 hours.

title: Stocks Up on Amex and OTC; Turnover Continues to Be Light
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange rebounded yesterday in slightly steppedup but still light trading. In the counter market, prices also rose in slightly decreased trading.

title: Why I Am Running
description: ATLANTAI have been repeatedly asked by the press and public why anyone would want to run for the Presidency in 1976. The question itself is a comment on the state of the Republic.

title: Bicentennial CallIn Show
description: WNYCAM will broadcast tomorrow from 11 A.M. to 2 P.M. American Issues Forum, a monthly Bicentennial program that includes a live, national callin system for listener comments and questions. Robert Cromie is the host for the National Public Radio show. Tomorrow's topic is A Nation of NationsFrom the Mayflower to Ellis Island.

title: Large Numbers of Snapper, Bluefish Appearing All Along Coastal Waters
description: With only a few exceptions, striped bass angling along the East Coast from New Jersey north was poor from midsummer on, but the moderate days and cool nights of September and October will soon chill abnormally warm ocean, sound and bay waters, and with that the fishing should improve.

title: Hawk Missiles for Jordan
description: WASHINGTONIn the controversy this summer over the Administration's desire to sell to. Jordan fourteen batteries of Hawk surfacetoair missiles, and other military equipment, there was an unfortunate absence of discussion about the significance of such arms transfers to the preservation of King Hussein's regime.

title: ROCKEFELLER PLAN SPLITS FORD AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4Vice President Rockefeller has encountered strong opposition within the Ford Administration to his drive to win the Pres ident's support for a proposed quasipublic corporation that would channel up to $100bil lion in financing to projects aimed at making the United States independent of foreign sources of energy.

title: Polk Joins Miami Nine
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla., Sept. 4 (UPI)Ron Polk, the National Collegiate coach of the year at Georgia Southern in 1973, was hired today as an assistant to Ron Mazur, the University of Miami baseball coach.

title: The Proceedings In The U.N. Today
Swordfish Is in Season And Here's a Good Recipe
description: The following recipe for broiled swordfish, which is now in season, is adapted from From Julia Child's Kitchen.

title: WBAI Is Seeking $18,000
description: Radio station WBAIFM is trying to raise $18,000 in cash this week to avert what the station's manager, Larry Josephson, called a cash flow emergency.

title: Memorial Mass for de Valera Brings 2,000 to St. Patrick's
description: Old friends and admirers of Eamon de Valera almost filled St. Patrick's Cathedral at noon yesterday for a memorial mass for the former Prime Minister and President of Ireland, who died Aug. 28.

title: Miller to Visit Coal Strike Area And Confer With Union Locals
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Sept. 4 (UPI)  The United Mine Workers' president, Arnold Miller, will travel to the coalfields of southern West Virginia for the first time during the monthold walkout.

title: August Sales of U.S. Cars Off 16.8%, but Rate Is Best for 75s
description: DETROIT, Sept. 4  American newcar sales in August were down 16.8 per cent from the same month last year but the annual selling rate reached 7.7 million, best of the 1975model year.

title: Half of Trenton Waterless; Emergency System Falters
description: TRENTON, Sept. 4The city's creeping water crisis hit home with a vengeance today as the makeshift supply system began to break down, leaving more than half of 220,000 resiIdents of the city and three suburbs without running water

title: Elena Sorokin, 81, Botanist, Widow of Sociologist, Dies
description: WINCHESTER, Mass., Sept. 4 (AP)Elena Sorokin, a noted botanist, died Tuesday at her home. She was 81 years old.

title: State Department Is Heartened By AntiRed Moves in Lisbon
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 State Department officials told Congressional leaders today that they were more hopeful about the political outlook in Portugal as a result of recent gains of more moderate forces over proCommunists there.

title: IVAN MAISKY DIES; SOVIET DIPLOMAT
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 4 (Reuters) Ivan Maisky, a leading Soviet diplomat in the nineteentwenties and thirties and a participant in the Yalta and Potsdam conferences, has died in Moscow, it was announced tonight. He was 91 years old.

title: FARM VOTE REPORTED BY COAST LABOR AIDE
description: FRESNO, Calif., Sept. 4The first secret ballot representation election to be held under the state's new Farm Labor Relation Law will be held tomorrow evening at an artichoke ranch in Castroville, a coastal town about 200 miles from here, according to a spokesman for the state Agricultural Labor Relations Board.

title: ANNA POSNER
description: Anna Posner, longtime ownermanager of the Brickman Hotel, a resort complex in the Catskill Mountains, died Wednesday at the Community General Hospital in Monticello, N.Y. She was 87 years old and lived at the hotel in South Fallsburg.

title: DR. LESLIE O. ASHTON
description: Dr. Leslie O. Ashton, a professor emeritus of pediatrics at New York University Hospital, died Tuesday in Doctors Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived at 340 East 72d Street.

title: Catholic Order Criticizes Playboy Ad
description: A promotion advertisement by Playboy magazine this week has drawn sharp criticism from a religious order that was a focus of the promotion.

title: West Relying More on Weapons Sales to Mideast
description: LONDON, Sept. 4The major weaponsproducing nations of the West are relying more and more on arms exports to the Middle East to help offset the increased costs of oil.

title: John Barnett Rites on Sunday
description: A memorial service for John. R. Barnett, editor of the frond page of The Wall Street Journal, will be held Sunday at 4:30 P.M. at St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Chuch. Sheraton Avenue, HoHoKus, N.J., where Mr. Barnett lived. Mr. Barnet, who was 37 years old, was killed last Friday in an accident on the Pennsylvania turnpike.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A statewide campaign for voter approval in the Nov. 4 election of the proposed equalrights amendment to the State Constitution began yesterday with messages of support from Governor Carey, Mayor Beame and other officials. A proamendment group, the New York Coalition for Equal Rights, opened an office at 11 West 42d Street.

title: Mets Set To Face Cardinals
description: With the National League schedule down to the final 23 days, neither the Mets or the St. Louis Cardinals can afford to lose the threegame series between the teams that opens tonight at Shea Stadium.

title: JOHN SANDOR MAKES DEBUT AT CITY OPERA
description: Decent, even adequate, opera tenors being in short supply, the debut of John Sandor with the New York City Opera on Wednesday night was a largely satisfactory affair He appeared in Bellini's T Puritani that Lord Arturo Talbot, a role that begins with a nastily exposed aria.

title: Royal Ballet II Is in Step at the Edinburgh Festival
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, Sept. 4Britain has two Royal Ballets. One we know in New York, but the second is quite unknown to us. It occasionally appears in London, at the Royal Opera House or the Sadlers Wells Theater, traverses the British provinces, and once in a while it will make a European tour. But so far as North America is concerned it is an unknown company.

title: House Unit, 2410, Backs Curbs On Real Estate as Tax Shelters
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The House Ways and Means Committee voted today to put a virtual end to the use of real estate tax shelters, which have enabled business executives and professional men with incomes in excess of $100,000 a year to pay little or no Federal income tax.

title: 5 Die in Pennsylvania Crash
description: BUTLER, Pa., Sept. 4 (UPI)Five persons were killed and three others seriously injured today in a twocar collision near this western Pennsylvania community. The state police said the drivers were among those killed when one car failed to observe a stop sign.

title: Ford Urges Speedy Vote On American Role in Sinai
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 President Ford and Secretary of State Kissinger asked Congress today to approve the stationing of Americans in Sinai within two and a half weeks, stating the speedy action was necessary so the IsraeliEgyptian accord could PO into effect.

title: Mayor of Bridgeport Is Named to U.S. Post
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (UPI)President Ford announced today the appointment of Nicholas A. Panuzio, the Mayor of Bridgeport, Conn., as a Commissioner of the General Services Administration.

title: SADAT SAYS SOVIET IS TRYING TO SPLIT ARABS OVER SINAI
description: CAIRO, Sept. 4President Anwar elSadat accused the Soviet Union today of seeking to divide the Arab countries by staying away from the signing of the EgyptianIsraeli disengagement agreement at Geneva.

title: Supply Adequate For Oil Products, Statistics Indicate
description: The United States moves into the fall season with adequate supplies of crude oil and all petroleum products, according to figures released yesterday by the American Petroleum Institute.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Work began on a $5.8million modernization program to improve living conditions at the Stella Wright Homes in Newark, scene of one of the nation's longest rent strikes, from 1970 to 1974. The occasion was marked by a ceremony on the groundfloor level of one of the seven buildings in the complex. The project, financed by the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development, is expected to take two years. The renovation includes an upgraded electronic security system and a reduction in the number of housing units from 1,206 to 1,100.

title: Commodity Price Index Off 1.5 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials fell to 206.9 from 208.4 last week.

title: Hearst Grand Jury Unexpectedly Dismisses the Scotts
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Sept. 4Jack and Micki Scott refused today to testify before a Federal grand jury looking into the whereabouts of Patricia Hearst, and then were unexpectedly told by Federal prosecutors here to return to their home and await further instructions.

title: Tingley's 74 Paces Senior Qualifiers
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 9James Tingley, a 56yearold insurance sales executive playing out of Nassau Country Club on Long Island, won the medal today in the Metropolitan sectional qualifying round for the United States Golf Association Senior championship over the par 35, 3671 6,310yard Round Hill Club course with a 34, 4074.

title: H.E.W. Withdraws Rules on Hospitals; A.M.A. Drops Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (AP) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare today withdrew new regulations, strongly opposed by doctors, that would have required hospitals to police the care of Medicare and Medicaid patients.

title: 5State Layoff Announced
description: BOSTON, Sept. 4The New England Telephone Company said today that it was laying off 1,400 employes in five states, most of them in Massachusetts, because its business was growing more slowly than it had expected.

title: JENISH NEW YEAR STARTS TONIGHT
description: Leaders of major Jewish groups yesterday expressed concern over the plight of Soviet Jews and, one day before the start of Rosh haShanah, called for the safeguarding of Israel's future.

title: China Expected to Become A Major Producer of Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 China appears to be moving toward becoming a major oilproducing nation, and the Ford Administration has reacted to this prospect by trying to discourage American oil companies from drilling in waters that the Chinese claim.

title: Red Sox Win, 31; Lead by 8 Games
description: Throwing errors by Brooks Robinson and Lee May on the same play led to a pair of Boston runs in the first inning, and the Red Sox went on to score a 31 victory over the Baltimore Orioles last night in Baltimore. It gave the Red Sox a sweep of the twogame series and raised their lead in the American League's East Division to eight games over the secondplace Orioles.

title: Music: DuoPiano Debut
description: Bijan and Holly Yakouboff, a twopiano team, made its New York debut Wednesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall with a program of fairly light pieces agreeably performed. The husband and wife duo, graduates of the Juilliard School, generally played in close synchronization. Though there were spots of blurred fingerwork, clean lines, unclotted textures and judicious balancing of voices were the rule.

title: At InteriorNot Again
description: No one could reasonably expect President Ford, given his general outlook, to choose a new Secretary of the Interior from the upper reaches of the Sierra Club or the Wilderness Society. The country had reason to hope, however, that after the difficulties surrounding his earlier appointment of former Gov. Stanley K. Hathaway of Wyoming to that post he would now pick a man of national prestigeone especially authoritative in the fields of environmental protection, energy and the preservation of natural resources. It is all but official that he intends, instead, to appoint former Representative Thomas S. Kleppe of North Dakota, a man with neither national standing nor any visible qualifications for the job.

title: No Theatrics in Teacher Negotiations
description: Labor negotiations are usually at least as much theater as substance, with each side grandstanding for the public and its members while it negotiates from a more flexible position. But by all accounts, the contract talks between the teachers' union and the Board of Education are mostly substance; the histrionics have been limited to the street theater of a Brooklyn Bridge march, which this summer has become de rigueur for frustrated public employes. But at the bargaining table, the Board of Education and the United Federation of Teachers talk about the issues they talk about publicly, and their positions are no less rigid in private.

title: A FRIEND OF HOFFA IS HEARD BY JURY
description: DETROIT, Sept. 4 (UPI)A Detroitarea businessman believed to be the last person to talk with James R. Hoffa, former president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, before he vanished July 30, testified today before a Federal grand jury investigating Mr. Hoffa's disappearance.

title: UNION AIDE HELD IN WEST GERMANY
description: KARLSRUHE, West Germany, Sept. 4 (Reuters)A senior official of West Germany's largest trade union has been arrested on suspicion of spying for. East Germany, the federal prosecutor's office said here today.

title: 20,000 City Teachers Press Demands; FactFinding Panel Is Called Into Talks
description: More than 20,000 city teachers demonstrated outside Board of Education headquarters and at City Hall yesterday afternoon as a state factfinding panel was summoned in a new effort to break the impasse in teachercontract negotiations.

title: An Oversupply of Water Led to Critical Shortage
description: TRENTON, Sept. 4The water crisis that has left more than 100,000 city and suburban residents without running water was caused by an overabundance of water and a city worker's attempt to prevent overflowing at the city reservoir, according to the city official in charge of the water system.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: BELFERPeter. June 28, 1946Sept 5, 1971 HE CHERISHED THE GIFT OF LIFE Mom and Dad

title: INSANITY PLEA SEEN IN SLAYING OF GIRL
description: NUTLEY, Sept. 4 (AP)Authorities indicated today that Marie Horst would probably plead insanity in the slaying of her 4yearold daughter. They said it was unlikely she would ever go to trial.

title: National League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Mr. Ford's Dilemma
description: That was good advice moderate Republican Senators gave President Ford, but it may prove hard for him to accept. Believing an incumbent can easily be renominated despite a conservative challenge by Ronald Reagan, the Senators urged Mr. Ford to soften his public pronouncements lest he alienate the moderate Democrats and independents needed to elect any Republican Presidential candidate.

title: Some Questions and Answers On Sinai Pact and Role of U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The new Sinai agreement between Egypt and Israel has raised a number of questions pertaining not only to the accord itself, but also to the American role in bringing it about. Following are some answers, based on available information about the agreement, to these questions:

title: A Youngster's Visit to the Dentist Needn't Be So Terrifying
description: When an adult stretches out on a dentist's chair, likely as not the heart begins to pound and the palms go moist.

title: Great Western Plans Offer for Bates
description: The Great Western United Corporation, which last year was taken over by Nelson Bunker Hunt and William Herbert Hunt of Dallas, announced yesterday that it would make a tender offer for the Bates Manufacturing Company, Inc.

title: Retailers and Refiners Urge Price Control Revival
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4Service station operators and independent oil refiners urged Senators today to revive price controls by overriding a Presidential veto expected within days.

title: Jets' Special Fear: Redskin Specialists
description: On some clubs they call the special teams the money teams, as if to make the players feel more important.

title: Carnegie Hall Mounts Its First Fund Drive,
description: Carnegie Hall, which has been defying the odds by running at a profit since it was saved from the wreckers 15 years ago, is now in the red, as is almost every other cultural in stitution in the country. It is not seriously in the red yet but it is definitely there. And for the first time since the city bought the doomed hall in 1960 and turned it over to the Carnegie Hall Corporation, a fund drive has been started. The aim is not only to balance the books, but also to sustain the quality level of programs.

title: Excerpts From Sadat Speech on Pact and Its Critics
description: Throughout our negotiations to reach a second disengagement agreement in Sinai, we never forgot for a moment the cause of the people of Palestine and the need to realize a second disengagement on the Syrian front.

title: Possibility of Default Stirs Concern by Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 Congressional leaders expressed mounting concern today over New York City's fiscal Crisis, after months of general hostility and indifference in the past by many members of Congress.

title: Eagles' Owner Wins in Court
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 4 (UPI) The Philadelphia Eagles' owner, Leonard H. Tose, won a sixyear court battle today against the former owner Jerry Wolman, over Wolman's claim that he had a right to buy back the National Football League team.

title: A Higher Connecticut Rate On Bonds Laid to Crisis Here
description: HARTFORD, Sept. 4 (UPI)The Connecticut State Treasurer, Henry E. Parker, said today that New York City's financial crisis was costing the state money in the form of a higher rate of interest on the sale of $100million of state bonds.

title: Byrne's Bond Plan Voted Unanimously By Jersey Senate
description: TRENTON, Sept. 4Governor Byrne's $882million proposed bond issue was approved unanimously by the State Senate this evening after the Governor attempted to allay fears that such borrowing would not make New Jersey end up in the same kind of fiscal crisis facing New York City.

title: Good News From Britain
description: Something happened in Britain this week that would have been regarded as a miracle even a year ago. The Trades Union Congress10.3 million strongvoted by a margin of better than two to one to accept Government ceiling of six pounds ($12.60) a week for pay raises during the next year.

title: Lyin' Fitz, the Beautiful Dreamer
description: Recently I listened to a discussion among stewards at an Eastern race track, Phil Bieber writes. They spoke of the difficulties they encountered arriving at a just decision in borderline cases involving possible infringements of the rules. The talk brought to mind another incident involving that loveable dreamerschemer, Lyin' Fitz McGee, who could enlist the officials as unwitting accomplices.

title: Suffolk Law Vendetta
description: The Byzantine politics of Suffolk County, long a tight little island dominated by Republican town officials and leaders, has taken a vicious and despairing turn. The only gainers can be criminal elements, in and out office, operating cavalierly in the eastern county of Long Island.

title: People and Business
description: Edward Gelsthorpe, executive vice president and chief. operating officer of the United Brands Company, who was passed over for the presidency of that food company four months ago, resigned yesterday to become president and chief operating officer of H. P. Hood, Inc., the Boston dairy company.

title: The New French Food Revolution? Julia Child Says, Humph
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.A new Julia is on the way.

title: 36 U. S. OFFICERS ALREADY IN SINAI
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 4  The United States presence already is well established in Sinai, where a small group of American military observers performs inspection assignments with the United Nations Emergency Force.

title: Advertising
description: Hertz will be pouring most of its fourthquarter advertising budget into commercials on professional football telecasts to show off its new superspokesman, O.J. Simpson.

title: Israel and Egypt Sign Their New Pact; Ceremony Is Shunned by Soviet and U.S.
description: GENEVA, Sept. 4 (Reuters)Representatix es of Egypt and Israel, seated at separate tables, signed their new interim peace agreement here today.

title: The Rescue Mission
description: The imminent danger of municipal default appears to be bringing a consensus in the special legislative session at Albany on the need for unity to save New York from that calamity. The key actors in this dramatic rescue missionthe Municipal Assistance Corporation, Governor Carey, Mayor Beame, the banks and the civil service labor unionsseem ready to bury their conflicting interests in recognition of the one overriding interest they all share. This is to put together an emergency financing package that will secure the city's immediate cash flow and provide a threemonth breather in which to establish a durable foundation for future stability.

title: Tolls on City Bridges Sought by U.S. Agency
description: The United States Environmental Protection Agency is seeking to get the city to impose tolls on East River and Harlem River Bridges as a measure to reduce air pollution, according to Robert A. Low, the city's Environmental Protection Administrator.

title: Westport Police Protest Is a Hairy Issue
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Sept. 4 The police in this polite suburban town did not shave this morning, in what is probably the metropolitan region's most polite municipal labor dispute in recent memory.

title: RUTH WALDO DIES; EARLY AD WOMAN
description: Ruth F. Waldo, a former vice president of the J. Walter Thompson Company, died last Saturday at her home in Bridgeport, Conn. She was 89 years old.

title: A Day of Jobless Pay Proposed In States WorkSharing Plan
description: A worksharing proposal by a task force appointed by Governor Carey  to keep workers on the job for fourday weeks supplemented by unemploymentinsurance benefits for the fifth daywas disclosed here yesterday.

title: Baxter, Davison Met. Golf Victors
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Sept. 4Rex Baxter of Glen Oaks and Pete Davison of Middle Bay, won the 36hole bestball Metropolitan Professional Golfers Association propro tournament, which ended today at Kutsher's Country Club. Baxter and Davison came in with a score of 132 to take the $1,600 first prize.

title: Possibility of Default Stirs Concern by Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4Congressional leaders expressed mounting concern today over New York City's fiscal crisis, after months of general hostility and indifference in the past by many members of Congress.

title: FORD WILL ALLOW SENATORS TO SEE NIXON'S RECORDS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The Ford Administration agreed today to give the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence access to the Nixon Presidential papersa decision that sources said was forced by Secretary of State Kissinger's secret testimony before the committee last month.

title: Carey Regards Default As Peril to State Projects
description: ALBANY, Sept. 4Bidding for the support of upstate and suburban legislators for his attempts to halt a New York City's fiscal crisis, Governor Carey said today that $1.5billion in State University, housing and other construction throughout the state would be jeopardized by a default.

title: ExJustice Carlton A. Fisher Of State Supreme Court, 78
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 4 (AP)Carlton A. Fisher, a retires State Supreme Court justice, and former national commandant of the Marine Corps League, died last night at the Veterans Administration Hospital here after a long illness. He was 78 years old and lived in Cheektowaga, a Buffalo suburb.

title: Cosmos Lose in Sweden
description: STOCKHOLM, Sept. 4 (UPI) A Swedish allstar team beat the New York Cosmos, 32, in an exhibition soccer game tonight Pel scored both goals for the Cosmos.

title: About Real Estate
description: An arrangement that has been normal in heavy construction for several years is making an appearancewith modifications  in custom home building and other relatively small projects. It offers the owner a potential saving that may be substantial. But, predictably, there is no free lunch.

title: F.T.C. OPENS DRIVE ON PROTEIN LABEL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The Federal Trade Commission announced its intention today to force a $100million food supplement industry to label its products with the statement that they are useless for most persons and dangerous for many.

title: EMIGRATION DATA ISSUED BY SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 4Tass, the Soviet press agency, today cited some rarely circulated Soviet Government statistics to support its contention that Moscow was not responsible for the decline in Soviet Jewish emigration to Israel.

title: Europeans Worried by Pressure on U.S. to Cut Nuclear Weapons
description: BONN, Sept. 4The 7,000 American tactical nuclear weapons stored in Europe are becoming a critically important issue as the Western allies prepare to resume talks with the Soviet Union on reducing the number of Soviet and American troops in Central Europe.

title: Beame Insists Power Remains In City Hall Despite Carey Plan
description: ALBANY, Sept. 4Obviously shaken by the events of the last few days, Mayor Beame never theless insisted tonight that City Hall was still the seat of power in the city.

title: Uneasiness Marks 2d Day of Catholic School Strike
description: You on strike, too? Judy Chance asked, rushing to hug a former English teacher whom she had not seen since last spring.

title: $882Million Bond Issue Is Voted by State Senate
description: TRENTON, Sept. 4Governor Byrne's $882million proposed bond issue was approved unanimously by the State Senate this evening after the Governor attempted to allay fears that such borrowing would not make New Jersey end up in the same kind of fiscal crisis facing New York City.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Buying through a real estate broker?

title: FORD WILL ALLOW SENATORS TO SEE NIXON'S RECORDS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The Ford Administration agreed today to give the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence access to the Nixon Presidential papersa decision that sources said was forced by Secretary of State Kissinger's secret testimony before the committee last month.

title: CARLETON CROWELL, CADET TRACK COACH
description: Carleton R. Crowell, head track and crosscountry coach of the United States Military Academy at West Point, N.Y., for the last 25 years, died yesterday in the Army Hospital at West Point, apparently of a heart attack. He was 62 years old.

title: URIAH HEEP DROPS BY FOR CONCERT IN PARK
description: Uriah Heep, the British rock band, ended the first segment of its current American tour at the Schaefer Music Festival in Central Park with a not particularly distinguished concert Wednesday night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Yanks, With May, Crush Tigers, 8 to 1
description: DETROIT, Sept. 4If the Yankees' 24 remaining games were with the hospitable Tigers here, they might be able to turn their distressing season around.

title: Growing Debt of the Poor Faces I.M.F.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4As the annual meeting of the World Bank and International Monetary Fund wound down today, with most private bankers and many Government officials already departea a long  respected Dutchman and a newly respected African addressed an almost  empty assembly hall. What they talked about was probably the essence of the meeting.

title: SALES INCREASE AT RETAIL CHAINS
description: August sales of the nation's largest retail chains rose above those of the month in 1974, according to their reports issued yesterday, but 4 of the 10 had gains that fell below the 8 to 10 per cent inflation rate in consumer goods.

title: Bidding Aggressive at Auction of Treasury Bills
description: The Treasury Department's auction of $1.5billion of 13day and 20day bills drew aggressive bidding in the credit markets yesterday. New entries in the corporate and taxexempt sectors also met a strong reception. The Treasury received 83billion of tenders for the 13day bills, selling $800million at an average rate of 6.175 per cent, with accepted bids ranging from 6.037 per cent to 6.231 per cent.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Books of The Times
description: It is not clear, at least to me, whether the contemporary short story is a child prodigy of our culture or its deformed creature, something like a thalidomide baby resulting from our attempt to soften the birth pains of technology. Is the short story a mere whirring of the computer, or a hint of incalculable human resources? Is it an addition to our instinctual arsenal, proof that we are still actively adapting, still perfecting consciousness as our principal defense against the increasingly sophisticated threats of an abstract environment? Whatever the new short story may be these are the kinds of questions raises. If some of them sound boring or pretentious, I can only say that this often happens today when you hold up the mirror either to nature or art.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold Prices Thursday. London: Morning fixing $152.00, up $1.65: afternoon flying $153.25, up $2.90.

title: Hunt Kicking Self Onto Giants
description: It appears that the Giants' wouldbe doublekicking threat, George Hunt, can win a place on the squad with his performance against the Cleveland Browns on Sunday.

title: What City in Default Would Be Like
description: Last week, someone mentioned to Governor Carey that the only way anyone could determine the effects of a municipal default on the economic and social fabric of the city would be to allow the default to happen. That, Mr. Carey replied, would be like going into a darkened room filled with volatile gas and lighting a match to see what was inside. There are many who reject Mr. Carey's apocalyptic image of a default, arguing that if the city defaults the day will probably be like any other day in the existence of the average New Yorker.

title: Toll in Water Crisis: Jobs and WashUps
description: TRENTON, Sept. 4It's one of those things, I guess, Jean Ward said when she returned to her apartment in Ewing Township this evening and found there was no water.

title: LOW OIL PRODUCTION SEEN FOR VENEZUELA
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Sept, 4  Venezuela's crudeoil production, now at its lowest point since 1956, will continue to be reduced until average daily output next year reaches 2.[09]million barrels a day, according to a government official.

title: Louisville, Suburbs Integrate Schools
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Sept. 4Louisville and surrounding Jefferson County became today the first major metropolitan area in the country to carry out the courtordered crossdistrict busing of children between the central city and the suburbs to achieve racial balance in the public schools.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 4 (UPI)Two top officials of the Houston Rockets agreed today, subject to court approval, to buy the majority share of stock in the National Basketball Association team held by Irvin Kaplan. Wayne B. Duddleston, chairman of the board of Texas Pro Sports, Inc., owners of the Rockets, and Ray Patterson, president and general manager of the team, will make the purchase with other minority stockholders. In June Kaplan filed a debt arrangement under Federal bankruptcy statutes. He had obtained 55 per cent ownership of the Rockets in January, 1974, at which time he also held majority ownership in the Houston Aeros team in the World Hockey Association. He recently sold his interest in the Aeros. Duddleston was one of the original investors who bought the Rockets from San Diego in 1971. Patterson joined the Rockets in 1972 after four years as president and general manager of the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: Rothschilds, Through Imetal, Seek First Large U.S. Industrial Stake
description: PARIS, Sept. 4The $110million bid for the Copperweld Corporation by a French holding company, Socit Imetal, represents an expansionary move by the Paris branch of the Rothschild financial interests to acquire what would be the family's first maior industrial stake in the United States.

title: Army Secretary, in Ft. Dix Visit, Upholds End of Training There
description: FORT DIX, Sept. 4After touring the facilities here today, Army Secretary Martin R. Hoffmann said he would not change plans to end basic training at this Army base by 1978.

title: Hall of Trenton Waterless; Emergency System Falters
description: TRENTON, Sept. 4  The city's creeping water crisis hit home with a vengeance today as the makeshift supply system began to break down, leaving more than half of 220,000 residents of the city and three suburbs without running water.

title: Sourcing of an Article Vexing Problem to Press
description: In a period of growing introspection on the part of the American press, one of the more worrisome problems to reporters and editors is what is called the sourcing of news articles.

title: FREDERICK A. MARTIN
description: Frederick A. Martin, a regional vice president for marketing of GTESylvania, Inc., died Wednesday, apparently of a heart attack, while on a business trip in Endicott, N. Y. He was 61 years old and lived in Lynfield, Mass.

title: F.T.C OPENS DRIVE ON PROTEIN LABEL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The Federal Trade Commission announced its intention today to force a $100million food supplement industry to label its products with the statement that they are useless for most per sons and dangerous for many.

title: France Pumps an Additional $7 Billion Into Program for Bolstering Economy
description: PARIS, Sept. 4  President Valry Giscard d'Estaing announced today the Government will pump an additional $7billion into the weakening French economy to raise productive activity and create more jobs.

title: British Petroleum Profit Fell 62.9% in 2d Quarter
A Sampling From the Publishers' Lists
description: Following is a sampling of some of the books publishers say should be among the more interesting this season:

title: Strike Is Threatened By Film Technicians
description: HOLLYWOOD, Sept. 4 (UPI)  A strike has been threatened by 18,000 technicians that could close dawn film and movie production for the first time in 29 years.

title: Laughing on the Outside, But Not Crying on the Inside
description: BALTIMOREFor years, as a frequent freelance writer, I had the occasion to take up the pen against the apparent absurdities of political lifeagainst those who wielded the sword.

title: Too Much Water Led to Too Little Water
description: TRENTON, Sept. 4The water crisis that has left more than 100,000 city and suburban residents without running water was caused by an overabundance of water and a city worker's attempt to prevent overflowing at the city reservoir, according to the city official in charge of the water system.

title: Coaches Cheer Roster Ruling
description: The National Collegiate Athletic Association is expected to appeal a Federal judge's decision Wednesday that threw out the association's limit of 48 players on a college football traveling squad.

title: Article 2  No Title
Borg, Orantes, Vilas Advance To Semifinals with Connors
description: Cramps, a questionable call and a broken racquet string became important factors in the quarterfinalround victories of Bjorn Borg, Manuel Orantes and Guillermo Vilas yesterday in the United States Open tennis championships.

title: HOLLOMAN CRITIC RESIGNS ABRUPTLY
description: A key member of the board of directors of the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation who has been critical of the corporation's alleged failure to take decisive action to meet the fiscal crisis has resigned abruptly.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In some editions of The New York Times Wednesday, a headline reported incorrectly that Adnan Khashoggi, a Saudi Arabian businessman, said he had kept a Lockheed gift intended for a Saudi general. The gift was from the Northrop Corporation, Mr. Khashoggi said.

title: In Poor Southern Portugal, Change Amid Old Problems
description: FERREIRA DO ALENTEJO, Portugal, Aug. 31The earlymorning sun beats fiercely down on the Alentejo, an expanse of wheat fields, aging cork oaks, olive groves, large, squat, whitewashed mansions and stark hamlets in southern Portugal.

title: UNIONS' FUNDS BUY TIME FOR THE CITY
description: Leaders of four city unions agreed yesterday to purchase $100  million in Municipal Assistance Corporation bonds today and avert imminent default by the city.

title: NonUrgent 911 Calls Rising, Despite Urgent Police Plea
description: In the huge communications room at Police Headquarters here the other day, Sgt. Eugene J. McDonnell was patiently talking to a woman who had dialed 911 because her cat had run up a tree.

title: About New York
description: The city's financial crisis is no laughing matter, but New Yorkers do manage to eke out a chuckle here and there. They behave in the same manner as other peoples have during history's most trying interludes when humor served as a local anesthetic to alleviate the pain. It does not cure the ailment, but it makes it easier to bear for a moment.

title: BOYS' SCHOOL WINS A DELAY ON GIRL
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 4The allboy tradition of one of the country's oldest bastions of male exclusivity was temporarily preserved today when a Federal Court delayed the enrollment of a 15 year old girl at this city's prestigious Central High School.

title: ALBANY HOSTAGES FREED MARE
description: ALBANY, Sept. 4A gunman who kept 10 persons hostage in a downtown sandwich shop for 17 hours after holding up a bank, injuring a bank guard, and shooting a policeman, surrendered to the police without a struggle about 8 A.M. today.

title: WALTER KEOGHDWYER
description: NEWTON. NT.J., Sept. 4 (AP) Walter KeoghDwyer, Sussex County freeholder director, died today of cancer at Newton Memorial Hospital. He was 55 years old.

title: American League
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: Harvester Is Increasing Prices on Trucks Sept. 8
description: The International Harvester Company said yesterday in Chicago that it is raising the list prices on its medium and heavyduty trucks by an average of 5.2 per cent, effective Monday.

title: Judge Gives Hughes 2 Weeks To Prove That He Is Not Dead
description: A Manhattan Supreme Court Justice yesterday gave Howard] R., Hughes, the billionaireindustrialist, two weeks to prove he is not dead.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: Sweden in a Furor Over Tax Escapes By Prominent Men
description: STOCKHOLM, Sept. 4 (Reuters)The governing Social Democrats, who are fervent advocates of a classless society, have been severely embarrassed by disclosures of heavy income tax deductions by a number of prominent Swedes, among them the Minister of Finance.

title: F. T.C.'s Staff Doubts Attempt To Stifle Independent Refiners
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The staff of the Federal Trade Commission told Congress today that it doubted that the major oil companies would try, in the continued absence of price controls, to kill off independent refiners in a costprice squeeze.

title: Through Brooklyn, With Dismay
description: MARBLEHEAD, MASS. Y fatherin  law turned his Cadillac left onto Utica Avenue and headed north for the Interboro Park way. We had attended a middleclass Jewish wedding in a residential, treelined area of Brooklyn. Continuing on Utica, perhaps ten blocks from the synagogue, we sped into a spectacularly ravaged section of Brooklyn.

title: Courts Act in Teacher Strikes; Million Children Are Still Idle
description: Some 50,000 teachers walking picket lines in 11 states kept nearly a million children home from school again yesterday as courts in two states ordered teachers either to return to work or to resume bargaining with school officials.

title: A Westchester Consumer Bill Is Vetoed
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 5Alfred B. DelBello, the Westchester County Executive, signed a consumerprotection code into law today, but vetoed is bill giving enforcement powers to the Sealer of Weights and Measures.

title: COURT REVERSES SCHOOL LAYOFFS
description: A State Supreme Court justice ordered the Board of Education yesterday to reinstate to their jobs 400 guidance counselors, 1,500 kindergarten teachers and 100 attendance teachers who have been laid off because of the city's fiscal crisis.

title: Plan for Bus Fare Discount For Jobless Backed by I.C.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The Interstate Commerce Commission announced today qualified approval of Continental Trailways Inc.'s plan to give a 50 per cent fare discount to unemployed persons.

title: Weeden Registers Loss
description: The Weeden Holding Corporation, parent of the Weeden securities organization, said yesterday it lost $271,000 last month against a $944,000 loss a year earlier. Trading in August stood at 13.4 million shares against 12.7 million a year earlier.

title: Nuptials in Scarsdale For Marilyn E. Lewis
description: Marilyn E. Lewis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paton Lewis of Scarsdale, N. Y., was married there last evening to Thomas H. D'Alessandro, son of Mr. and Mrs. Armando D'Alessandro of Yonkers. The Rev. Paul Beam pertormed the ceremony in the Scarsdale Community Baptist Church.

title: New Lisbon Regime Dims Luster of Estoril as Bluebloods' Haven
description: ESTORIL, Portugal, Sept. 4 Portugal's Golden Triangle stretches 22 mites from this luxury beach resort to the fashionable fishing village of Cascais and the lust green mountain spa of Sintra.

title: 4 U.S. Presidents Have Been Slain
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP) of the four American Presidents slain in office, only John F. Kennedy was not physically close to his killer. The sniper's bullet that killed him was fired at his motorcade in Dallas, Tex., from a distance of 265 feet, according to the Warren Commission.

title: CBS Hunting Show Loses Ads After GunClub Calls
description: More than half a dozen advertisers withdrew their commercials from last night's CBS telecast of a news documentary on hunting after receiving calls from the National Rifle Association and a variety of gun and hunting groups around the country, according to CBS.

title: Clerides Warns of Collapse For Cyprus Peace Talks
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Sept. 5 (AP) Glafkos Clerides, the Greek Cypriote negotiator, said today that the Cyprus peace talks would collapse if the Turkish side failed to submit detailed proposals for a settlement.

title: CAREY IS PRESSING CITYAID PACKAGE TO BAR DISASTER
description: ALBANY, Sept. 5Governor Carey called on a reluctant Legislature today to approve his plan to prevent default in New York City, terming the threat an unparalleled disaster that would paralyze vital government functions, endangering the health, safety and welfare of the more than 12 million people in the city and region.

title: Sealyham Is Best at Tarrytown
description: TARRYTO W N, N.Y., Sept. 5 A whitecoated Sealyham from Wales keeps right on winning. When Dersade Dobbys Giri was named best of 1,179 dogs in the Tuxedo Park fixture today at Lyndhurst, it was the third time in seven days that she won the silverware for Mrs. Dorothy Wiener of Churchtown, Pa.

title: GOLD
description: By The Associated Press

title: House Passes Bill to Fund Research on Electric Cars
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI) The House passed a $160million measure today to promote research and development of electricpowered vehicles over the next five years as one answer to the nation's energy problem.

title: Miss Mann Is Leader By 2 on 67
description: DALLAS, Sept. 5 (UPI)Carol Mann shrugged off a flash of lightning as she walked onto the final green, dropped a twofoot birdie putt for a fiveunderpar 67 and took a twostroke lead today after the first round of the Dallas Women's open golf tournament.

title: Bomb Blasts Lobby At London Hilton; 2 Dead and 63 Hurt
description: LONDON, Sept. 5A bomb exploded in the crowded lobby of the London Hilton Hotel in Park Lane today, killing two persons and wounding 63, seven of them seriously.

title: Retailers Drop Major Appliances
description: The Korvette stores and Gertz Long Island, two of the New York area's largest retailers, are currently phasing out their white goods major appliance business after a long period of lagging profits in that type of merchandise.

title: South Africa Tells Lisbon Of Troop Move Into Angola
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Sept. 5 (Reuters)South Africa today published the text of a note she sent to Portugal admitting that her troops had crossed into Angola, where rival nationalist movements are fighting.

title: DR. ANDREW L. NUQUIST
description: Dr. Andrew L. Nuquist, professor emeritus of political science at the University of Vermont, died Thursday at his home in Jericho, Vt. He was 69 years old.

title: ANDERSON SEEKS U.S. AID FOR CITY
description: ALBANY, Sept. 5Warren M. Anderson, the Senate majority leader and the state's most powerful Republican, said today that the Federal Government should involve itself in the New York City fiscal crisis.

title: The Censor's Night Out
description: Gorilla comes into a saloon, walks up to the bar and says, Give me a dry martini. Bartender mixes it, gives it to him, wicks at the other customers, says, That'll be ten bucks.

title: Dance: Spoofs at New York Festival
U. S. Mayors Fear Default Here; Say It Would Injure Bond Sales
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Mayors across the nation have expressed fear of the impact a New York City default would have on their own cities, including expected curtailment of programs because of their inability to borrow money, officials of three municipal organi lations said today.

title: Miss Evert Gains Final With Miss Goolagong
description: After five rounds of much ado about nothing, the women will have something to shout about in the final of the United States Open tennis championships today at the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills. Queens.

title: 15 Lebanese Soldiers Hurt In Attack on an Army Base
description: TRIPOLI, Lebanon, Sept. 5 (Reuters)Rockets and mortar shells struck an army barracks here, wounding some 15 soldiers as a general strike to protest factional violence today entered its third day, security sources said.

title: Fresh Air Over Lima
description: With his first acts as President of Peru, Gen. Francisco Morales Bermdez has enhanced his reputation as an officer of moderation and common sense. His Government has issued a decree allowing all deported political leaders and journalists to return home from exile and permitting all publications closed by former President Juan Velasco Alvarado to resume operations.

title: Thomas Graham, Wendy Vilas Wed
description: Ann Wendell Vilas, daughter of Mrs. William Howard Vilas of Greens Farms. Conn., and the late Mr. Vilas, was married yesterday afternoon to Thomas Graham, who served with the Peace Corps in Lucknow, India. The Rev. Robert W. Ilhoff performed the ceremony in Trinity Episcopal Church on Broadway at Wall Street.

title: New Villard Houses Plan Preserves the Gold Room
description: Harry B. Helmsley, the realestate developer, said yesterday that he would present a revised set of plans to the city for his proposed hoteloffice building to rise behind the landmark Villard Houses on Madison Avenue, calling for the preservation of the famed Gold Room there and expanding the hotel and office combination to include apartments as well.

title: Leading French Newspaper To Dismiss 115 Employes
description: PARIS, Sept. 5 (Reuters)The leading French newspaper, Le Figaro, plans to dismiss 70 journalists and 45 other employes as part of economy cutbacks, a spokesman for the newspaper said today.

title: Michael S. Striker, 69, Dies; International Patent Lawyer
description: Michael S. Striker, a leading patent lawyer, died Thursday at Mount Sinai Hospital after a short illness. He was 69 years old and had homes at 285 Central Park West, in New City, N.Y., and in Duncans, Jamaica, W.I.

title: None Hurt as Blast In Utah Damages Kennecott Offices
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Sept. 5 (UPI)A bomb exploded early today in a restroom in the Kennecott Building. Two persons, identifying themselves as members of the Weather Underground, said the blast was to protest the Kennecott Copper Corporation's ties to the present Government of Chile.

title: Giving Them Anything, It Seems, but a Job
description: The United States is on the brink of becoming a permanently divided societya society deeply split between the ever fewer who are employed and the ever more who, while willing and able to work, cannot find employment on a sustained basis.

title: Tomahawks Lose; Series Tied at 11
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Sept. 5  Larry Smeltzer, who allowed 19 goals Wednesday night, registered 55 saves tonight to lead the Quebec Caribous to a 108 upset victory over the Long Island Tomahawks, the defending champions, in the semifinals of the National Lacrosse League playoffs. The fourofsevengame series is tied, 11.

title: Drug Dealer With Latin Ties Convicted at Brooklyn Trial
description: A major narcotics dealer with connections in Latin America and Spain was convicted yesterday in Federal Court in Brooklyn of conspiring to import, possess and distribute large quantities of drugs.

title: Relief Curb Is Barred
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5 (AP) Superior Court Judge Samuel Adams issued a temporary restraining order today barring. the state from dropping employable persons from the general relief rolls on Monday.

title: Fiscal Crisis at a Glance
description: Because its budget is out of balance, and because incoming revenues flow erratically, the city must borrow hundreds of millions of dollars each month to meet expenses, including shortterm borrowing obligations that come due. But banks and other investors have refused, since early this year, to buy the city's notes and bonds.

title: City Rejects Order by U.S. To Impose Toll on Bridges
description: The city will not consent to an order by the Federal Environmental Protection Agency to impose Si roundtrip tolls on the East and Harlem River bridges to reduce air polution by discouraging traffic, Robert A. Low, the city's Environmental Protection Administrator, said yesterday.

title: FARM LABOR TALLY BARRED ON COAST
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Sept. 5A Superior Court judge late yesterday issued a temporary restraining order here prohibit ing the state's Agricultural Labor Relations Board from counting ballots tonight in the first union representation election to be held under the state's new secretballot election law for farm workers.

title: 8 Are Killed in Argentina In New Political Violence
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 5 (Reuters)Eight persons were killed in three separate incidents in political violence in Argentina today.

title: Kaplan, the Owner Of Houston Rockets, Is Indicted in Fraud
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Sept. 5The majority owner of the Houston Rockets basketball team, Irvin Replan, has been named in nine indictments for fraud in the purchase of $3,050,098 worth of bonds, Texas Securities Commissioner Roy W. Mouer has announced.

title: A Leader in Ecuador Revolt Leaves for Exile in Chile
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Sept. 5 (Reuters)Maj. Roberto Augustin Varas, one of the leaders of an unsuccessful military rebellion against the Government of President Guillermo Rodriguez Lara on Monday, left here today for exile in Chile, the Foreign Ministry announced.

title: Football Racism Weighed
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Sept. 5 (AP)Federal civil rights and local government officials said today, that they would investigate to determine if racism was involved in the dropping of an 8yearold black youth, Tony Bryant, from an Elkssponsored football team.

title: WALKOUTS AFFECT 4 SCHOOL DISTRICTS
description: TRENTON, Sept. 5Teacher unrest over wages and rights in New Jersey mounted today as four school districts reported job actions that closed schools and kept more than 14,000 children out of classes in the first week after the long summer recess.

title: Water Returns to Trenton; Boiling Is Recommended
description: TRENTON, Sept. 5Water began flowing into the city's trunk lines from its main filtration and pumping plant at 2:30 P.M. today, signaling the beginning of the end of the weeklong water emergency.

title: Radicalizing Education In New York City
description: Albert Shanker has announced that the United Federation of Teachers expects to negotiate a fully equitable wage increase and is not prepared to negotiate concerning proposals to cut costs and increase productivity.

title: Corporate Profile
description: The reward for success is conflictthis is what the Copperweld Corporation of Pittsburgh, a company that has been outstandingly successful in the fabrication of copper, steel, and aluminum products, has found out.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: JULIAN BOND OBTAINS F.B.I. FILE ON HIM
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 5 (AP) State Senator Julian Bond disclosed yesterday a 78page file kept on him by the Federal Bureau of Investigation and a letter informing him that agents had arrested and convicted a person who had threatened Mr. Bond and other wellknown persons.

title: Alex DiLorenzo Jr. Dies; Leader in Real Estate, 58
description: Alex DiLorenzo Jr., who with his partner, Sol Goldman, built and operated the largest real estate empire in New York city, died yesterday of a heart attack in his office in the Chrysler Building. He was 58 years old and lived on Kings Point Road in Great Neck, L.I.

title: Sudan Rebels Stage Coup But Loyal Troops Crush It
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Sept. 5 (AP)Rebel army officers seized the state radiostation early today and announced that the Government had been overtluawn, but the uprising was crushed within hours by loyalist troops.

title: BAILPOLICY STUDY IS URGED BY HUGHES
description: CHERRY HILL, Sept. 5 (UPI)  Chief Justice Richard J. Hughes said today a review of bail policies was needed to insure that lenient judges did not let dangerous criminals on the streets.

title: Dual Purpose Funds
description: Week ended Sept. 5, 1975 Following is a weekly listing of the unaudited net asset value applicable to the capital shares of dualpurpose Investment companies at close of business Friday. Also shown are closing listed market prices of best overthecounter dealertodealer asked Prices for the capital shares of each company Premium) e percentage difference (discount or premium) between the net asset value and the asked prices of the capital shares.

title: Notes on People
description: The American judicial system could learn from the British about legal ethics, selfdiscipline and the decorum that keeps a trial from turning into something resembling a barroom brawl, Chief Justice Warren E. Burger said yesterday in Provo, Utah.

title: U.S. MAYORS FEAR DEFAULT BY CITY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 Mayors across the nation have expressed fear of the impact a New York City default would have on their own cities, including expected curtailment of programs because of their inability to borrow money, officials of three municipal organizations said today.

title: WOMAN NOT LISTED AS SECURITY PERIL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5A White House spokesman said today that Lynette Alice Fromme, who was charged with the attempted assassination of President Ford, was not on the Secret Service list of persons representing a potential threat to the security of the President.

title: Jews Observe Start of Rosh haShanah
description: Rabbis asserted in Rosh haShanah sermons last night that the Unied States must assure Israel's territorial and political integrity because of Israel's concessions to achieve a tentative peace agreement with Egypt.

title: Schroeder Leads by 2 On 66
description: COLUMBUS, Ga., Sept. 5 (AP)John Schroeder, apparently out of his seasonlong slump, continued his sharp shooting today, carding a 66, and took a twostroke lead after the second round of the $100,000 Southern open golf tournament. His total was 131, nine under par.

title: Cost of Joint Effort Held at Half Billion
description: ISFAHAN, Iran, Aug. 31E. I. duPont de Nemours & Co., Inc.; in a joint venture with Iranian investors, is to start construction soon of an artificial fiber plant near this central Iranian city that will be one of the country's costliest private industrial development projects.

title: Rockefeller Says He's Doubtful Congress Would Vote City Aid
description: ROCHESTER, Sept. 5 (AP)Vice President Rockefeller said today that New York City could not solve its financial problems alone, but that he doubted the Federal Government could help.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MONZA, Italy, Sept. 5 (UPI)Niki Lauda, the Austrian driver who needs just half a point in the last two Formula One races of the season to clinch the world drivers' championship, set a lap record for practice at the Monza circuit today as trials opened for the Italian Grand Prix. Lauda, driving a Ferrari, averaged more than 138 miles an hour his lap of 1 minute 32.82 seconds. Lauda set the previous practice record last year of 1:33.16. Clay Regazzoni of Switzerland, his teammate, was second fastest in practice. Carlos Reutemann of Argentina, the only driver with a chance to beat Lauda for the driver's title, was third fastest in a Brabham. Lauda merely has to finish among the first six Sunday to win his first world championship. In order for Reutemann to take the title he must place first at Monza and first again in the United States Grand Prix, Oct. 5 at Watkins Glen, N.Y., while Lauda finishes out of the top six in these last two races. Mario Andretti was clocked in 1:35.17 in a Parnelli, 11th fastest time of the day.

title: Bank and 3 Indicted
GAIN IS REPORTED IN TEACHER TALKS
description: State mediators reported a little progress yesterday in talks for a teacher contract, but said the city was approachthe start of the fall school term on Monday in the shadow of a possible teachers' strike.

title: INJUNCTION ORDERS UNION TO LOAD GRAIN
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 5 (AP) A Federal judge signed a 90day injunction today ordering longshoremen here to load hips with grain purchased by the Soviet Union and forbidding the longshoremen's union to try any evasive tactics.

title: TeenAgers of Yore Line Up to Pay $40 For Night of Sinatra
description: Some of the people who once paid as little as 40 cents to hear Frank Sinatra at the old Paramount Theater back in the early nineteenforties are paying as much as $40 for an orchestra seat to hear him at the Uris Theater for two weeks, beginning Monday.

title: Norway Price Freeze Set
description: OSLO, Sept. 5 (Reuters) The Norwegian Government announced today a price freeze backdated to Sept. 1 until Dec. 31. Prices raised since Sept. 1 will have to be lowered to the level on that date. The freeze covers both public and private sectors.

title: OWNING HANDGUN IS EASY ON COAST
description: SAN FRANCISCO Sept. 5California law, like that of most states, carries virtually no restrictions whatsoever on the ownership of rifles or handguns.

title: King of Cocos Islands Rejects Australia's Bid
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Sept. 5 (AP)John CluniesRoss, who is known as the king of the Cocos Islands, has rejected Australia's offer to buy his remote Indian Ocean Paradise for $3.5million.

title: Suspect Was Defender Of the Manson Family
description: Lynette Alice Fromme, the 26yearold woman charged yesterday with the attempted murder of President Ford, was one of the earliest and most devoted followers of Charles M. Manson, who became a national symbol or senseless violence after a series of ritualistic murders in 1969 by members of his cult.

title: SENATE SPY PANEL TO OPEN SESSIONS
description: WASHINGTON Sept. 5Thee Senate Select Committee on Intelligence will begin on Sept. 16 its first public hearings in an eightmonthlong investigaton of the intelligence community, but the content is so secret that the committee would not announce either the subject matter or a full list of witnesses.

title: Premier Rabin Sees Almost No Chance Of Pact With Syria
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 5Premier Yitzhak Rabin declared today that there was virtually no chance for an interim agreement with Syria and indicated that there was a difference of opinion on that issue with the United States.

title: Mass Transit Bank
description: Senator Philip A. Hart of Michigan hasnot for the first timeintroduced legislation so obviously sensible that it is difficult to see how it can be opposed on its merits. His bill calls for a Mass Transit Development Bank which would serve both to encourage automobile manufacturers to compete for rail and bus equipment business and to provide jobs for unemployed auto workers.

title: Raiders Topple Cowboys, 31 to 20
description: DALLAS, Sept. 5 (AP) Ken Stabler passed for two touchdowns in a threeminute span of the second quarter tonight and the Oakland Raiders went on to defeat the Dallas Cowboys, 3120, in a National Football League preseason game.

title: CAREY IS PRESSING CITYAID PACKAGE TO BAR DISASTER
description: ALBANY, Sept. 5Governor Carey called on a reluctant Legislature today to approve his plan to prevent default in New York City, terming the threat an unparalleled disaster that would paralyze vital government functions, endangering the health, safety and welfare of the more than 12 million people in the city and region.

title: A Round for Freedom
description: Portugal's military rulers have finally delivered a sharp setback to the cause of Sovietstyle Communism by removing Gen. Vasco Goncalves from the High Council of the Revolution, thus barring his appointment as chief of staff of the Armed Forces. President Francisco da Costa Gomes finally acquiescedobviously with great reluctance and only after a stormy session of the Armed Forces general assemblyin cancellation of his plan shift General Gonalves from the Premiership to the highest military nost.

title: Mets Win, 52; 21st for Seaver
Suffolk D.A. Fears Police Goon Squad
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Sept. 5Henry F. O'Brien, the Suffolk County District Attorney, said today that Eugene R. Kelley, the county's Police Commissioner and his political rival, had assigned a goon squad to comb various homosexual bars and dredge lies in an effort to discredit him.

title: Contract Awards
description: TheSperry Rand Corporation has received two Navy contracts totaling $26.9million. One is for $17.9million for development and support of a data system and $8.9million award for tracking equipment for missile firecontrol systems.

title: J. M. Tanski Weds Janet F. Burlingame
description: Janet Elizabeth Burlingame, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Francis Burlingame of Darien, Conn., was married last evening to James Michael Tanski, son of Mrs. J. William Tanski of Plainville, Conn., and the late Mr. Tanski. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. William Donovan in St. Thomas More Roman Catholic Church in Darien.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Now that Liz and Richard are together again, the matchmakers of the world need a romance to repair. They might have one. Quietly, the love match between Chris Evert and Jimmy Connors appears to be on serve again. That was evident in the green and white tent that is the inquisition chamber for competitors in the United States Open tournament. Chris Evert was perched prettily on a metal folding chair behind a small table. Her racquets were piled in front of her and a towel was draped over her blue and red trimmed white bareback dress.

title: Souvanna Phouma Says He Plans to Retire in '76
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Sept. 5 (Agence FrancePresse) Prince Souvanna Phouma, the neutralist Premier of Laos, says he plans to retire from politics after general elections for a new national assembly are held next April.

title: NonOklahoma Judge Is Sought To Try Case of HomeStake Co.
description: TULSA. Okla., Sept. 5 (UPI)  United States District Judge Allen E. Barrow, citing an expected lengthy trial of 12 ment, indicted in an alleged $100million HomeStake Production Company swindle, will ask that a judge from outside Oklahoma be assigned to the case.

title: Dayan Captures a New Strongholdthe Lecture Hall
description: He is a familiar figurethe black eyepatch making him instantly recognizable  as well as a controversial personality and a distinctive speaker.

title: Fiscal Crisis at a Glance
description: Because its budget is out of balance, and because incoming revenues flow erratically, the city must borrow hundreds of millions of dollars each month to meet expenses, including shortterm borrowing obligations that come due. But banks and other investors have refused, since early this year, to buy the city's notes and bonds.

title: Telephone Repairman Finds Dog Menace In Name Only

description: NASHVILLE, Sept. 5 (UPI)The Dawson Gang, a group of bandits who have roamed the Southeast for five years, holding up banks and obtaining more than $2million in loot, has been broken up, the authorities said yesterday.

description: WILLIMANTIC, Conn., Sept. 5 (AP)Warren Kimbro, a former Black Panther who admitted killing a fellow Panther in 1969, was unanimously approved today for an assistant deanship at Eastern Connecticut State College.

title: FORD SAFE AS GUARD SEIZES A GUN WOMAN POINTED AT HIM ON COAST; FOLLOWER OF MANSON IS CHARGED
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Sept. 5A young woman pointed a .45caliber semi automatic pistol at President Ford at close range today, but a Secret Service agent saved the President from possible harrn by grabbing the gun and forcing it from the woman's hand.
